Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Negbs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a wonderful Location next to Parco Borghese and away from hustle and bustle of City and if you know Rome the traffic can be very noisy!! About 20 minutes walk from Spanish steps or you can use hotel free Shuttle bus to be dropped of near Spanish steps. The SPA is magnificent and it is free to use for the Guests . The hotel is very Roman style and character and some people might find it too glitzy or Ritzy but it goes hand in hand with character of Rome and extremely clean. We had great time and recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good (albeit an expensive) choice for staying with children in Rome”
Reviews.Author: panjabigastronome
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location in the quiet embassy quarter next to the wonderful Parco Borghese. The building itself is rather unremarkable from the outside, but very ornate inside with plenty of polished wood & brass, marble and chandeliers. The 'superior' rooms are well decorated with a balcony, but of an average size; beds are a good size and reasonably comfortable. Each room has a large flat screen TV, and (a very expensive) minibar. Two things that are lacking are tea/cofee making facilities in the room, and any means of ironing - the hotel does not supply an iron, so bring your own! The breakfast is very good with an extensive choice. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant as it was quite expensive, quite empty and not the kind of place that children will have appreciated. From May onwards, there is also a grill restaurant that is open which might provide more casual dining. There are quite a few restaurants nearby, within 10 minutes walking distance: both Casa Mia & Taverna Rossini can be highly recommended. The spa is excellent with a large pool and was a great place for everyone to relax after a hard day's sightseeing. Caps are required for the pool and can be purchased for €5. The outdoor pool is also open from May onwards. It is possible to walk to via veneto in about 20 minutes and to the Spanish Steps in 30 minutes. The hotel does provide a shuttle service to these locations, but you have to make your own way back. You can catch the number 19 tram nearby and it will take you to direct to St Peter's and the Vatican. The number 3 bus (also from a nearby stop) will take you to the Colliseum and Roman Forum, although the route is fairly circuitous! Tickets are €1 each (children under 1 m height are free) and need to bought from a newstand (closest is via veneto) and then validated on the bus/tram. The hotel airport transfer is expensive; taxis are a bit cheaper, but the best option is to pre-book online with Rome Cabs who provide an excellent and reasonably priced service. This is (I believe) the only hotel in central Rome with a pool, and its quite location next to the park makes it an excellent (albeit, expensive) choice if travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: continuitygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for business recently, the hotel was very nice if a little old fashioned, but it did feel like it was in the middle of nowhere as you either had to get taxis or walk for about 20 minutes to get anywhere. The room was a good size, the breakfast was lovely and the spa was great.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon In Rome,April 2012.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon. Upon arrival to the hotel the appearance of the building was less than five star, but we had been expecting this after reading other tripadvisor reviews. Once we pulled up to the grand entrance we were impressed. This was clearly a five star lobby. We had also organised an E class Mercedes Benz to transfer us from the airport at a cost of 72 euros. This was organized via an email address given to me by a fellow tripadvisor member. This service was good because taxis cost 60 euros and we could have booked a transfer through the travel agent for a much higher cost per person. So we thought it better to arrive in style. At the airport the driver was waiting for us with a sign in my name (I had requested it to say Mr and Mrs ... but it just said our surname. My new wife was slightly disappointed at this). We were given a room on the forth floor (we had paid extra for a deluxe double), it met our expectations and we had been given a room with a fantastic view to St Peter's Cathedral and out over the Villa Borghese Park. The room did smell of stale smoke on arrival but to be fair we hadn't requested a smoking or non-smoking room as we hadn't realised you could get rooms that allowed smoking. We just got used to the smell and didn't notice it after the first day. The bed was a twin pushed together and we had requested a double but as the view from the room was so nice we didn't want to risk getting an inferior room if we complained. The bed was nice and big and comfortable. The sheets were luxurious. The TV was great with a wide selection of movies etc. We paid $25 euro's for 24 hour unlimited access to programmes which was great when we just fancied a break from walking around. The mini bar was extortionate but we never used it. Instead we purchased water and alcohol from the many refreshment stands in the park and took them back to the room where there was space for them in the mini bar fridge. No one ever removed them and we had no extra charges on our bill. We considered eating in the hotel restaurant for ease but decided against it only due to the fact we'd probably be the only people eating in there. We didn't fancy a restaurant all to ourselves. The menu did sound good, a little pricey but no different to some of the other restaurants we visited in Rome. We had a drink at the bar one night which was nice to sit in the plush surroundings, a peroni cost $7 and a pina colada $14, it was expensive but worth it. The hotel is most definitely geared up for the business traveller rather than the tourist, and certainly doesn't provide any little extra touches for a couple on honeymoon. We did realise this though before booking due to other reviews placed. It was a little disappointing but we went for the hotel mainly because of the spa and its antique Italian style décor. The breakfast, which was included in our room rate had an extensive choice of items, from cooked meats, cold meats, cheese, smoked salmon to pastries, cakes, cereals, donuts and yoghurt's, not to mention the fresh fruit selection and variety of drinks on offer including prosecco which yes we did indulge in, seeing as it was our honeymoon! The Prince Spa was amazing. We used it as often as we could. We had to fill in a form on our first visit and we gave our room number each time we used it but had no more forms to fill in on each visit. We knew from reviews about having to wear a swimming cap so we brought some with us and we were fine to wear these. The spa staff were happy to provide you with a robe and flip flops or for you to bring them from the room. The male sauna area was closed for maintenance work during our stay but this meant that men could use the female facilities, this worked out perfectly for us as we could stay together. The relaxation area was lovely to lie in after a swim and sauna and you are provided with mint tea or water. It was a little colder than we'd have liked in this area. There was a real flame effect fire on the wall in this room but I'm not sure if it worked or just gave the appearance of being warm. We enjoyed sitting in here with a book after a spa session. We didn't use the gym or the I-Food lounge. We considered having a treatment but they were quite expensive as to be expected. It was enough to use the spa facilities. The location was a 25/30 minute walk into the centre of Rome. The first time we walked it it did seem a long way but once we got used to it it was nothing and it is a lovely and romantic park to stroll through. There are bikes, golf carts and go carts available to hire in the park for a reasonable cost, we just ran out of time to do this. In the park is the Zoo which we did visit. It was $13 each per adult. It was worth a visit and the animals seemed happy and well cared for (we are always a bit dubious about Zoo's). Once you reach the edge of the park you suddenly find yourself overlooking Rome, it is a breathtaking view! If you turn left you'll reach the Spanish steps, take a right and you'll end up at the People's Piazza. We ate in a variety of places including the Hi Res restaurant at Hotel Valadier just off Piazza del Popolo. It is a modern restaurant with stunning views over the rooftops of Rome, well worth a visit for a special evening. It's at the pricier end but good food and wine menu's. You do feel in luxury here.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Seyyah-Rus
Reviews.Content: Located next to a magnificent landscape in the vicinity of city center. Nicely decorated rooms facing an amazing garden.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and elegant”
Reviews.Author: acwilcheck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice but small elevator, great breakfast included, nice spa and pools, room was large, quiet neighborhood on edge of Borghese Gardens. Although some might feel the walk was long to get to other sights, it was a pretty walk through the park. My only negative comment was that the concierge gave us two bad recommendations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug47648
Reviews.Content: Parco dei Principi is a large hotel in a beautiful old building which has been extended. Therefore some bits have more character than others. Rooms: Not massive, we had a twin room but the beds were close together - I prefer a twin room to have a bedside cabinet (at least) between the beds. The most disappointing thing about the room was the balcony which had no furniture on it. Beds: The bed was a bit hard for both my friend and I. I'm not usually that fussy, but this one was a bit too hard. Location: The walk into the centre during the day is a lovely walk, you walk through the Villa Borguese Park, then come out at the top of the Spanish steps or into Plaza dei Pompei if you prefer. It takes about 20-30 minutes but it is a lovely walk. However, at night, not quite the same, the park is closed and the walk along the roadway is not pleasant, definitely time for a taxi. The Spa: I would still come back to this hotel because of the Spa. Hardly any hotels in Rome have indoor pools, this hotel has a large (20-25 metre) indoor pool. Beside the pool is a spa circuit (the water is warmer in the spa circuit. Then through a small opening from the pool is the Sauna and Steam room areas. These are split into male and female. The pool has good opening hours so easy to get a swim in before breakfast and late in the evening. Entry to the pool is free if you are staying at the hotel. Spa Beauty Treatments: We had mixed success. I had a lovely reflexology treatment and a good massage but my friend was disappointed with her hot stone massage. The treatments are VERY expensive so look out for morning sessions when they offer 20% off the price. Catacombs: There are some great catacombs circa 25 minutes walk from the hotel (in the opposite direction to the main centre) The catacombs of Priscilla, 00199 - via Salaria, 430 - tel. & fax 06 86 20 62 72 (closed on Mondays)

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a city trip but primarily a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: looooosey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night trip to Rome. Booked this hotel for its quiet location and beautiful interior shots as previous trips to other parts of Italy proved that hotel standards are generally not as high as in other parts of Europe. After being ripped off by an airport taxi (60 euros!!) to get to the hotel we were slightly surprised to see that the hotel was quite unremarkable from the outside. Stepping inside though it has been beautifully decorated in an opulent style throughout. The staff were helpful and efficient and our room was just as described, good size and lovely decor. Have to say that the breakfast every day was fantastic, everything you could want and even a glass of prosecco if you wish. The hotel is a 15 min walk into the city itself but as you are walking through the beautiful Borghese gardens this is nothing but a pleasure.We did not have time to use the spa unfortunately as after a long day of sightseeing by the time we got back to the hotel we were ready just to crawl into bed. Gave the hotel three stars as although the facilities were good and hotel was of a good standard we felt slightly out of place as we seemed to be the only tourists staying. Everybody else was business men there for a Libya Oil/Gas Convention and a conference on the future of Israel. Had a fantstic time in Rome, it is a truly beautiful city and we felt that should we return we would like to be closer to the centre of the city based in a more traditional building although maybe in the height of summer and the tourist season you would be glad of a little escapism!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: doIhaveto_merseyside
Reviews.Content: Went for the Scotland v Italy game at the Stadio Olympico, so used the hotel as a base for two nights. It was comfortable if pricy. However, Rome is a pricy place, so be prepared to be over the odds for a service that you would otherwise get in the UK for a fraction of the cost. As for Impactdancer's comment on Harry's Bar. Yes, it wasn't bad, but with the cheapest starter kicking in at €26 cheap it ain't. Did appreciate the waiving of the late checkout charge. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, no locks on balcony doors”
Reviews.Author: Impactdancer
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is a stunning hotel inside. Nothing to write home about on the outside, but stunning interior design. Rooms are a very good size, excellent facilities and in a quiet location near to Borghese. Be aware that there are no locks on the balcony doors. I had a hilarious conversation with reception about this on the first night: Me "I can't lock the balcony doors" Reception "they don't lock" Me " What happens if someone gets in?" Reception "It hasn't happened in the past" Me "Oh well hopefully I will see you in the morning then!" Be prepared to pay some serious money for drinks at the bar. A vodka diet coke and a vodka tonic was 32 euro. The minibar is also quite pricey. I think a vodka was 13.5 euros. I think the spa is owned or run by a separate company. They were very strict on who comes in and out. Everyday they checked who we were, room number, sign for this, sign for that, etc. which to be honest got a little irritating. The treatments are good and the spa facilities are excellent. Try the emotional showers and the jacuzzis. You have to wear a swim cap in the pool or they will charge you 6 euros for one. The gym is excellent but the food at the little cafe was poor. Food in the restaurant was ok, the portions were very good and of course, as with all bars and restaurants in Rome, it came with lots of little extras. There are taxis outside the hotel day and night. The Via del Corso shopping area is about 12 euros away. This area is well worth a visit. We didn't think the Castel Romano shopping centre was very good - not as cheap as they make out and its 29 euros each (and a 1 hr journey) to get there. Visit Harry's Bar, a 5 minute taxi from the hotel, it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SPA WITH A VIEW ON ROME”
Reviews.Author: Biavati
Reviews.Content: We went many times in this Hotel in Rome. This time, with friends, we choosed Parco dei Principi for its location almost inside Villa Borghese Park and Galleria Borghese Museum. So we enjoyed the regular exhibition of the gallery plus some pieces from Louvre and other museums all over the world, in temporary display. After a day around the most important museums and palaces of Rome, it was so nice to pamper ourselves with the amazing spa (and gym!) located underground the hotel! You will find a big pool (plus, on summer the wonderful pool in the garden) with quit spaces for jacuzzi massage, kneipp pools, fizzy beds (underwater beds with bubbles all over), strong neck showers, a "wet parlor" with hammam, sauna, ice shower ...you will love it. Obviously enough, they will charge you only for massages and beauty cares. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LuckySCGirl
Reviews.Content: Second time visiting Rome and enjoyed staying here versus in the middle of the city. Hotel is elegant yet comfortable. They upgraded us to a suite with an incredible view of Borghese park and it had a balcony with table and chairs outside which was really nice. Our room showed a few signs of wear and tear (mainly the carpet), but nothing major. It was very clean and the bed comfortable. Enjoyed the park and riding bikes, even in the rain. Located near many embassies, high end homes and some great restaurants filled with "locals". It is an easy walk to the busy part of Rome. Was quiet since not in the middle of the city. Sheets are linen, which is a luxury in Italy. The breakfast buffet was absolutely the best I have ever seen in a hotel in Europe. Many, many choices of hot and cold foods, fabulous pateries, fruits, etc. Enjoyed the bar at night and the very friendly bar tenders.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: GaryMooreRIP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Parco Dei Principi in mid-February 2012, as it was mid-term for our three children (oldest 8 years). What attracted us to the hotel was the proximity to the zoo (literally across the road - we could see camels, ostriches and oryx from our balcony) and also to the Via Veneto, less than 10 mins walk away, plus the very good value for money when booking online 3-4 months in advance. When booking, we enquired about connecting rooms and the hotel was extremely helpful to us. On arrival, the reception staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating, and the ambience and quality of the ground floor public areas was superb - real "old style" 5 star Italian charm. The two connected bedrooms we had on the 3rd floor were also extremely well-appointed and of high quality in terms of furnishings, technology, comfort etc. We tended to eat breakfast in the hotel, which was just what you'd expect in a 5-star hotel, and filled us up for much of the day, and then we ate out in the evenings during our 3 day stay in Rome. We couldn't fault this hotel - some 5 star establishments might look down on families with small (and potentially noisy) kids but the Parco Dei Principi was very welcoming and made us feel at home. Prices were very reasonable, the hotel could not have been nicer, and we would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Admittedly elegant but formal hotel, poor service and eye wateringly expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel very grand and the rooms are nice and though we didn't use it the spa is supposed to be excellent. However grand equals formal and stuffy and the service is of the same ilk and as a result there is no atmosphere in the bar or lounge areas. However the most stand out thing about the hotel is the stratospheric prices for food and drink whatever you do don't order a sandwich and chips at the bar......!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Stay !”
Reviews.Author: Lea70
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 persons, I decided to book this hotel reading tripadvisor rewiews, is a very massive and beautiful building, few minutes walking from Via Veneto and Villa Borgese, the hall is fine and clean, reception staff gentle as the floor maids. The room it was large and confortable, very tidy and quiet, breakfast supreme ! Unfortunately is not in the center of Rome, we use a limo service ( limofirst.com ), a super service, fast and chip, we used twice, to the hotel and from hotel to the airport. What more say ? A nice stay in Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced, poor customer service, disappointing honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidExplorer01
Reviews.Content: Having just spent my honeymoon in Rome at Parco dei Principi, I feel compelled to share my disappointing experience to those considering staying at this hotel. The food and drink prices are extortionate, e.g. minibar 50cl water - €9, 33cl can of coke - €20!!! At the lobby bar, we were shocked when charged €20 for a tiny chocolate mousse (not on the menu). Hotel Restaurant food was good but again very overpriced and portions are small - we were snowed in so we had no choice but to eat here. Breakfast buffet had a selection of pastries, fresh fruit and cereals, but food was not refreshed every morning and at €17 was definitely not good value for money. Prince Spa was the only good thing about this hotel, but the culture of trying to squeeze money out of you continues - water machines were not working in gym or pool area so we had to pay for water, if you want to use the pool you are required to purchase a swimming cap for €6. Overall, service from concierge was ok but we felt as if we were a burden whenever asking for anything. The night before check out I requested to pay my bill before going to bed since we were leaving very early the next morning. The concierge staff said it would be a nuisance as he had "already begun closing the till for the day" and asked if I could wake up 20 mins earlier. I said this would be an inconvenience for me (remember this is my honeymoon!!!) at which point he became angry, said that I "was being difficult" and then hung up on me! This really upset me and I was not given an apology by him in the morning upon leaving the hotel. This is the first review I have ever written but I felt I must share this with others as I would have thought twice had I read this first. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “We saw zebra from window :)”
Reviews.Author: irmos
Reviews.Content: We were on New Year eve 2012 in that hotel .The hotel is in a very nice area in the Borghese park with 10 minutes to Piazza del Popolo and 15 minutes nice walking to the Spanish Steps. The main attraction of this hotel is SPA. It is a huge area with a big swimming pool, Swedish shower and iced fountain. You can not go the SPA from a hotel elevator and it is maybe a little bit inconvenient to cross a main lobby in a robe so we had to take all changing clothes with us . They have outdoor swimming pool but it was a winter time so we did not have a chance to use it. The room is not big but a good size for the family of 2 adults and 1 child. We have a view to the zoo so everyday we can see zebras walking around :). The breakfast doesn’t have a big selection but there is no restaurant or café within 5 minutes walking distance so actually the hotel is the only way to have a breakfast. One day we were tied after walking around Rome and decided to have a dinner in the hotel and we were very delighted for our decision. The dinner was perfect. It is a very nice 5 star hotel and I think next time we will be definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for swimmers”
Reviews.Author: jjw45
Reviews.Content: If a regular swim is important for your holiday enjoyment, this has got to be the hotel of choice in Rome. The indoor pool is absolutely fabulous, possibly the best we have ever encountered in a hotel, and there are additional spar facilities in a very smart health club attached to the hotel that guests can use free(for the pool) Like many other good hotels in Rome it has an outdoor pool, but that is not much good at this time of year. The hotel itself is also very smart; our room was excellent and bottom of the range; the lobby area and bar very comfortable and plush and the staff were very helpful. We also really enjoyed the walk into Rome across the park, and the return taxi fares were not prohibitive. We particularly appreciated the lengthy and spectacular Fire Work display they laid on in the grounds to mark the New Year; sadly there were not many other guests who did. It is true to say that the prices in the restaurant looked far too high and we did not use it but otherwise this is a hotel we will try and come back to when we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: larscat
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in an excellent location, right on top of Borghese Park. I enjoy walking through the park each morning on my way to visit the antiquities in Rome. You do need to take a taxi back to the hotel after dark though, the park has very little lighting. Local restaurants are great - Fiori di Zucca makes the best pizza I've ever eaten. The only negative is the spa - during my visit there were a lot of families with children who lets their kids play in the spa area as if it were an outdoor pool. The noise was hideous and caused me to stay away from the area for my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel in the perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: angela_harrison
Reviews.Content: When you step into the reception at his hotel you know you have made the right decision. It is very grand and the staff are lovely. It is a tradtional hotel and perfect for our first stay in Rome. We loved he location as the walk through the Borgese Park each morning was lovely and light relief from the hustle and bustle of the city. we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem hidden north of Gallerie Borgese!”
Reviews.Author: edward b
Reviews.Content: Lets face it Rome and their hotels can be trying and be taken care of is the utmost factor along with a killer breakfast buffet. This is met by the Parco and then some. Their spa is killer, the pool is perfect after a long day of touring. Recommend the gelato and pizza joints right near the hotel especially Gaudi and the Embassy location is wonderful for safe and great street walking to work off the meal and the gelato. Every morning the wife and I went powerwalking in the park and it was heaven. You are only a taxi ride to all the sights even way down to Trastevere (the local foodie area). Forget public transport, too complicated and cheaper by cab if you factor loss of time and some peoples lack of hygene. Back to the hotel, a welcome respite from all the walking and did i mention the breakfast buffet where tipping the guys is crucial to being treated to that second cafe latte with haste! I have stayed at the excellisior and other hotels but for the price, value and experience this is the one!

Reviews.Title: “Just right and close by to all the sites in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: lostnyctraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved it. It was everything we hoped it would be. Beautiful lobby, the gorgeous park in the backyard and everyone was courteous and friendly. Thank God, no negative surprises. All was good and as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel on the Borghese Park”
Reviews.Author: Robin K
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this upscale, ornate and charming hotel. Our flight arrived very early on a Saturday morning so we knew it would be too early to check in. Bell staff were very accommodating tagging all of our luggage and front desk assured us a non-smoking room would be ready in a few hours. When we returned from some sight seeing, the room was ready as promised. It was on a lower floor, but spacious and well appointed. The heating/cooling system was somewhat dated, but we were able open our balcony door since it was an unusually warm afternoon. We booked via the internet and the rate was just under $200 U.S. but did NOT include breakfast. We thought this was a decent deal for such a high end hotel and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel and Spa near Borghese Gardens”
Reviews.Author: vbapat
Reviews.Content: I happened to visit Rome for a conference and stayed at Grand Hotel Parco Dei Principi. It is really grand as the name suggests. It is just adjecent to the Villa Borghese or Borghese garden. The Renaissance style decor takes you to another age and the feeling continues during your stay. It has a stylish spa and you can taste Italian food. I relished it! The Borghese garden is so close by that I could go there for a walk every morning and could also manage to visit the museum on one of the evenings. The front desk staff speaks English and they helped me to do some site seeing with the help of Vastour, a tour operator.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing, lovely pool area”
Reviews.Author: TJ1711
Reviews.Content: Although our room was smaller than we had hoped for, it was comfortable and well equipped with a generous sized bathroom. Tip top housekeeping service, lovely linen sheets and rooms regularly tidied. Ideal for our trip at the end of August as we could escape back to the attractive pool area to cool down and relax after sightseeing. Located in a very pleasant area next to the Borghese Park, a ten euro taxi ride; regular buses at the end of the road or a 10/15 minute walk gets you into the historic centre. There are a couple of local restaurants nearby. Perfect if you want to escape the heat of the city in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and really Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: alexandre r
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and bedroom in a nice quiet place. The service is really excellent with a professional staff always present when you need it. The only criticism is the breakfast which is not really good... PS : you have to pay for you bathrobe if you want to go to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: AvengerF
Reviews.Content: Spent ten days there for new year. Staff was professional, old ways. Room was spotless. The whole place is perfectly taken care of. Fantastic deal. Besides, you are a 5 minute walk from Via Veneto!

Reviews.Title: “A good old fashioned luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Old world luxury with beautiful public and private rooms, the Parco is a definite experience if you want a relaxing holiday in the centre of Rome. One of the few city centre hotels with a pool and also a great restaurant if you are looking for high end rather than traditional cuisine (and expect very European attitudes - for example the honey comb served with ice cream as a sweet included bees legs and wings stuck to it and this is considered quite normal but I think our colonial cousins may balk at this) It took quite a while for the desk staff to check us in on arrival as there seemed to be some high level politician or the like monopolising their time which annoyed me slightly but thereafter the staff were great The pool is nice and has a small gym adjacent but its only open part of the year of course as it's outdoors. If you're walking around Rom though be aware it's a little way out and you'll need to hike across the park to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: mum0f5
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Rooms, spa, pools, fitness centre all first rate. Extensive hot and cold buffet breakfast, even full English. I travelled with three older children and we were given interconnecting rooms with balconies overlooking the zoo. We saw zebra one morning! I expected the staff to be aloof, but we found them all to be friendly and helpful which was a surprise after reading some of the reviews. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A break to be remembered for all the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: Pier19
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel beside the park. Unfortunatly we were so busy we did not get to use the spa as much as we would have like to. The Spa was just fantastic so relaxing in the pool area(inside) and the Jacussies were wonderful. The outside pool was beautiful as was the weather so restful after a busy day sight seeing. The bedrooms were lovely and the bed linen was excellent and lovely touches to the room. Breakdfast had everything I would want great variety of foods and drinks. A short walk downhill though a beautiful park to the spanish steps need to like walking as we do, as not in the city centre. The park is beautiful and cool for a walk about -10-15 to spanish steps but we took taxi back as usually went out in the evening to eat and did not fancy the walk back. Would love to go back again another time.

Reviews.Title: “Roman baroque decor with some minus”
Reviews.Author: Stegold123
Reviews.Content: If you like the baroque very charged decor, this is a nice location you'll appreciate Rooms are spacious well served with views the one on the gardens and pool Service is always the minus!!! We were at a seminar for two days and no coffee/water available out Of the official breaks (1030 am - 0400 pm) Disappointing the detail of being in Italy having lunch in a nice hotel garden and discovering that served coffee has the same poor quality of France or Germany!!! Illy where are you? laundry service expensive (11euro for one shirt washed and ironed-in fact we are not in a crisis at all!) and not on time as promised. Very disappointing that hotel of this "standard" charge 22 euro for 24 hours Internet service!!!! Wake up guys in Paris all bistrot have free internet wi-fi! Bad very bad! Hotel is a bit out of the track you can walk to enjoy Rome hence I think in need of bein more competitive service wise

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Taxi Fare”
Reviews.Author: Hal K
Reviews.Content: This is a truly first class hotel with fine rooms, elegantly furnished, a magnificent pool, a terrace (with an awning) view of the Villa Borghese and the Vatican, a breakfast to die for, and, best of all, first class service. It is not in the old center of Rome or on the Metro so taxis may be required.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpl155
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic if you are in Rome when it's hot! Fantastic outdoor pool that we lived next too after sight seeing in the mornings. Good poolside food. The rom was well equipt with really really great block out blinds that keep me, who is normally an early riser, sleeping till 9am some mornings, lovely big bed, clean rooms. Only negative would be Internet is quite expensive

Reviews.Title: “There are many hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSydney54
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the good feature - on the first day the doorman was very nice and helpful. Unfortunatley he was not on duty again during our stay. The hotel was very tacky with superfical glitz . Also the lavatory had nasty yellow stains in it The main concern was that many charges were excessive and/or not declared. When we book and when we checked in the higher costs for subsequent nights were not explained to us. Secondly the cost of parking was 35 euros perday and the cost of the internet was 10 eauros per hour. Breakfast was extra.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: holiday_vacation33
Reviews.Content: We recently got stuck for 4 days in Rome due to the Hurricane in New York. My fiance's concierge recommended we stay at this hotel, so not trusting European hotels (at decent prices) we went to visit before we booked and instantly fell in love. This hotel is perfect, although it is not located within the hustle of Rome it is a quick cab ride to anywhere (example:10 min to Vatican). What the hotel website doesn't tell you is the underground 7 star spa! It is breathtaking. They have an indoor pool -free to hotel guests- that is unreal you have to see it to believe it. I can go on and on but will stop here. I will recommend this hotel to ANYONE I know going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: mfg7102
Reviews.Content: Just left a 4 day stay at the lovely Parco Hotel. Everybody form the porter to the Concierge in the horel was amazing. Maritizio Scarano one of the concierge should get conciergeof the year, making sure all restaurants, tours and cars were always ready. The rooms were impecable with a wonderful turndown service every evening. The pool was beautiful but for the only bad part the pool boy with short blonde hair is probably the meanest person on earth, but you learn to just make fun of him. Overall great experience and will be going back as soon as the europeans figure out the euro is killing their tourist economy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Great Spa”
Reviews.Author: Brian O
Reviews.Content: - Room was nice and clean but small. Bathroom was showing it's age and the air conditioning was not working 100%. - Had a great Balcony and the hotel had a rich Decor - Internet was well overpriced if you would need it considering everywhere else we stayed it was free -Pool was very clean and very beautiful - Location was good as long as you are willing to walk approx 25 mins to the city through a beautiful very active large park. This was perfect for us. -There were no restaurants in the immediate vicinity but within a few blocks there are some gems to choose from -People were very friendly and helpful - Hotel Parking is overpriced but there is city parking just outside the hotel that is very reasonable - The part that makes this hotel worth the price is the spa. It is a very relaxing experience and there is lots to do. From the Hydro massages to the large indoor pool and relaxation rooms the spa doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, serviceminded staff & charming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Appelon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a trip to Rome in April 2011. Very nice hotel with a fantastic atmosphere - this is the real Italian style, stunning decoration all over the hotel. The restaurant is just fantastic - don't miss it. Staff is very serviceminded and friendly, indoor pool is lovely. The outdoor pool looked nice, but to cold to be in the water outside in the start af april. I will defently be back at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: poppybinks
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in fabulous location. My American cousin and I arrived to an upgraded room with a view for our first trip to Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave us advice on how to get about. The walk down through the park of Villa Borghese was the perfect start to any visit to this amazing city and we arrived into the town down the Spanish Steps in bright sunshine, could it get any better. The spa was ideal after a long day walking and a glass of chardonnay on the terrace in the evening was just the icing on the cake. Coin thrown in the Trevi Fountain, so I hope to be back and would certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, fantastic spa but lacking some 5 star qualities”
Reviews.Author: Food_traveller32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for our honeymoon in june and we were quit happy with our choice. Pros: Proffesional and helpful staff, nice clean rooms well equipped, nice pool area and fantastic spa. Cons: Disapointing food, the lunch by the pool was the least good meal in Rome, quiet location aprox. 20 min. walk from down town. Overall good but compared to e.x Colonna Pevero in Porto Cervo its not the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and grounds but staff were indifferent and hardly helpful.”
Reviews.Author: kathynunn
Reviews.Content: We booked our visit through Citalia and paid extra for half board and as only dinner is included for Citalia customers. On booking in we were told we were only entitled to one dinner or lunch !we explained we had paid extra for half board but we were made to look as though we were trying to cheat them ! Eventually theyh rang Citalia and we were told everything was okay but twice we had to ask them to take the price of our dinner off of our bill. Lovely room, food etc but pity about the staff - they seem more interested in business customers than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel...with a few tradeoffs.”
Reviews.Author: aremk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our children for a few days while touring Rome. The hotel itself is very clean, inviting and well kept. The rooms (we had two overlooking the pool and gardens) were very nice. Big balcony, modern bath, comfortable beds, nice bath products, plush towels and great air conditioning (a must for Rome in the summer). Maid service was twice daily. The outdoor and indoor pools are fantastic -- by far in my opinion the best draw to this place. However, as others have mentioned the outdoor pool closes at 6pm which is way too early and partially negates one of the major plusses of this hotel. The hotel grounds are very quiet and it has a club-like exclusive feel. This is, as others have mentioned, where the trade off comes it. It is quite a distance from the major attractions of Rome. Cabs are not always stationed out front, which means waiting a few minutes for one and they can become expensive back and forth to the center of Rome say twice a day. The staff is professional, but somewhat indifferent and they dont really go out of thier way to help you find the best way back and forth from your sightseeing. In fact there are no maps, guides, etc in the lobby (you need to ask at the desk) and they dont give the best directions as to how to get somewhere, although some of that is likely a language barrier. It is possible to walk to the area of the Spanish Steps but its not a quick walk. Also, there are really no shops, cafes, etc within quick walking distance of the Parco...which means you need to really plan well and have your Caffe, Gelato, Vino, Snacks, etc while still in the center of Rome before getting into a taxi, or else you will be stuck with one of the Parco's big negtives -- food and drink is limited and very expensive. Having said that, being able to take a swim in the middle of the Roman summer afternoon before heading back out to sightsee, and then being able to enjoy the very nice indoor spa and quiet surroundings in the later evening upon returning makes it worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull property”
Reviews.Author: GrapeNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the center of Rome but has a terrific pool and inside spa. I wounldn't recommend the breakfast as it is totally overpriced and not very good. The room was very nice and the staff was very professional and helpful. The bartender Antonio was especially nice and helpful. The price of taxi's generally ran 8 to 12 euros.The hotel is very relaxing after a day of touring and I think it would make a wise choice.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting, comfy, quiet hotel with beautiful spa area; some distance from Rome attractions”
Reviews.Author: amwdew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (one adult, one child) for several days in June 2011 as part of a tour group visiting Rome. Hotel is very inviting and comfortable with an especially nice lobby area fully of couches and little sitting areas where you can meet friends or relax. Guest room was also very comfortable and well outfitted, with attractive and modern bath. Decor was a bit "heavy," and fussy, with velvet drapes and lots of fabric, fringe, etc., but the effect -- especially in the lobby -- was to project warmth and coziness. Only real complaints on room are that the sheets were scratchy and bed was kind of hard compared to what you'd find in, say, a nice Hampton Inn. But this didn't detract overly. Internet access, as usual, is an extra cost -- about $10 euros a day, and only usable on one device at a time (you have to buy multiple iterations of $10 euro sessions for more than one device). I cannot understand why nice hotels cannot provide free wifi like the cheapest Motel 6 does nowadays. The hotel amenities were lovely. Outdoor pool is in an enclosed garden type area and is big, clean, and attractive, with lots of lounge chairs and umbrellas around. Only drawback (and this is big if you are traveling with children and touring during the day) is that it closes at 6:00pm. This seemed a frequent situation in our travels in Italy, and is a shame because the best swimming time in my view (and that of my son) is 6-9pm when it's not as hot and the risk of sunburn is much less. New indoor "Prince" spa was GORGEOUS. Big, warm pool in a darkish room lit by indirect blue-tinged lighting, and even warmer, huge 'hot tub" type areas with four or five different massaging mechanisms (chairs that bubble, cascades that massage your shoulders, foot massage areas that you stand in, and a back massage area). Top it off with both hot and cold walking pools that invigorate your leg circulation. Truly lovely and was free for guest use (or at least this was the case the way our reservations were set up via the tour company, Tauck Bridges). There are also various steam rooms and services like massage that we didn't take advantage of. But this was the most beautiful hotel spa area I've ever visited. Food: breakfast buffet lavish and delicious. Many options, including yummy fresh fruits, enjoyed by both 12-year-olds and adults. Only large drawback of this hotel from a tourist's standpoint is that it isn't really in walking distance from much of anything except the Bourghese park and museum. To get to major Rome shopping districts, restaurants, or sights like Trevi Fountain, Piazza de Navona, Pantheon, etc., you are going to have to take a taxi to the tune of about $10 euros each way. This was quite disappointing and made things somewhat challenging for these first-time visitors to Rome. Once you've been there a few days, you figure out that you can walk through the park to Spanish steps and other areas -- but it's a pretty long way. On the plus side, the hotel is in a quiet neighborhood near various embassies and residences, so there is little traffic or street noise. So you feel like you're retreating to a quiet home in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: toultour
Reviews.Content: I was there for a seminar. Perfect for large teams. But for my week-end who followed, i changed and found better place for less expensive. Swimming pool only opens from 10 to 18. it's a shame.... Does not desserve the 300 euros price (discounted) per night

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with super French restaurant”
Reviews.Author: IanA63
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable 4 nights at this hotel. The room was well sized, with a decent sized balcony which we used frequently. We only discovered the quality of restaurant on the final night and we enjoyed it immensely. It was a true 5-star experience, however, wouldn't say the same for the hotel. 4 stars only. It's well situated for the Borghese gardens which we enjoyed meandering through a number of times during our stay, but is a little out of the way to the main tourist areas, which is good if that's what you want or not so good if you want to be in the heart of the action. Wouldn't stay again simply because there are so many other good quality hotels to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: Charles196
Reviews.Content: We just came back last week from three nights at the Parco dei Principi at the end of a two week trip through Italy. The purpose of our stay was to relax in and around the hotel and enjoy the spa. My advice to anyone considering this hotel would be to inspect the room you are assigned as soon as you enter. We stayed the first two nights in a standard room overlooking the pool with a balcony. Exceptionally nice view and very comfortable room. 100% 5 star luxury. Unfortunately, there was a leak in our tub, which flooded the bathroom twice (the hotel had told us they fixed the leak each time). For our third night we were switched to a junior suite, which was a nice gesture by the hotel. Unfortunately, the toilet in the suite barely flushed, and our last morning in the hotel there was barely any hot water. We had to take cold showers. We asked that the toilet be repaired but the plumber never showed up. On a more positive note, the spa was amazing and the outdoor swimming pool was beautiful. The spa also has an incredible indoor swiming pool complex. We regularly ate in the hotel and found the dinner restaurant to be excellent and the lunch and bar food much less so (and way too overpriced). Overall, I have given the hotel a 3 out 5 because for the price charged my girlfriend should have been able to take a bath without flooding the bathroom, the toilet should flush and there should be warm water consistently. Also, just a note that the suite did not have a balcony. Stick with the standard rooms. I would not recommend this hotel if your aim is touring as it is very out of the way and more for large groups or for couples who want some quiet time. The staff was always very very helpful. The manager did offer me a discount on my bill because of all of the basic room issues though it amounted to less than $100. Pretty meager considering the several thousand dollars we spent. For a hassle-free stay given the price you're better off at a newer hotel or a refurbished one. This hotel is terrific though (if you're willing to spend the money) so long as you make sure your room has no issues.

Reviews.Title: “A true five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bobflys
Reviews.Content: Quality in every aspect. Beautiful rooms and public areas, great service, good food, music,world class spa all in beautiful park setting. Concierge and all staff were terrific-friendly and helpful. Indoor and outdoor pools. Expensive and well worth it. I am told both President Clinton and Bush were guests here.

Reviews.Title: “You Pay for Bad Attitudes, Awful Bed, and can't find a guy to open a door for you!”
Reviews.Author: traveler11056
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful - but that really is it. The service was terrible. They treat you as though you are bothering them to do anything. The night staff was sweet and advised me what NOT to order from the room service menu - they also told me how sorry they were about our stay and urged us to write a truthful review about our stay. Please don't stay here. I don't want anyone to be as disappointed or intimidated by a hotel staff as I was. I live in NYC, we are not the obnoxious tourists that they treated us like. Just don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Very very disappointing! OVER-PRICED FOR POOR QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: dolcevita_21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is TOTALLY OVER-PRICED! from far... It is totally out of date. The bed are more than uncomfortable. The service quality is really poor and the breakfast offer is voiceless.... Internet access costs a hell. They are really living in another planet in this hotel... The only positive point in the hotel is the marvellous SPA... which is included in your room but you will have the surprise to pay 8euro for a bathcap which is necessary to enter the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, quirky but very agreeable”
Reviews.Author: Esherboy
Reviews.Content: Love the PdP - Superior Rooms very good, not huge but very good, clean and well appointed. Modern exterior contains a refurbished hotel designed in grand style - and it works in a quirky way. Excellent location for quiet stay out of citycentre, but close enough to sites and downtown (around 7-8 euros a time). Would probably use a downtown hotel for future visits, but PdP is excellent for groups (as we were) and people looking for decent service in an upmarket setting. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The pool is not worth it”
Reviews.Author: familyvacati0n04
Reviews.Content: I agree completely with the prior review. We stayed for 5 days in July 2010. The weather was very hot - 98 degrees every day - so we were grateful to have the pool. But, the hotel is shabby, uncomfortable, and the staff was not at all helpful, bordering on rude. By the second day, I asked my husband if we could move to a different hotel. But, we stuck it out, just because of the pool. The pool is more of a "quiet" pool, lots of adults. Since our children are a bit older, this was not a concern. But, if your children are used to "playing" in the pool and making a bit of noise, this is not the place to be. We did love the location - right near the Borghese gardens and the wonderful Borghese museum. But, that did mean that we were constantly in taxis when we wanted to visit the tourist sites. I can't imagine that there is not a nicer hotel in Rome, with a pool. If you are a traveling with a family, I would suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lion sculptures are all around you”
Reviews.Author: 5starhotelreviews
Reviews.Content: Contrary to expectation, hotel looks old like it was billed in midlevel period but its completely fake. Can you imagine heavy painted ceilings and very grandiose stile in place which is originally billed in 50's. We don't recommend to young people. Rooms are not big or they look smaller because of heavy furniture and many paintings. Apart from beautiful view on huge park, the best part of the hotel is great swimming pool !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but too far from sights”
Reviews.Author: MeAndMyBetterHalf
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with the hotel, staff, room. In fact it was a very elegant hotel. The lobby was spectacular. We ate in the hotel for dinner twice. Very elegant experience. The room was nice and clean. The staff was very accomodating. But the location was not in walking distance to anything. We had to spend a lot of money in Taxi's to get to part of Rome where we could start our day. The cab rides were about 10-14 Euros to wherever we wanted to go. This hotel is not close to shops or restaurants. The Spanish steps were the closest to the hotel. But not really in walking distance (at least in the cold)

Reviews.Title: “Walk through Villa Borghese and down the Spanish steps...”
Reviews.Author: Songbird1110
Reviews.Content: Everyday I walked through Villa Borghese and down the Spanish steps. If you want something fancy, you can find Harry's Bar and Cafe du Paris via Veneto about 10 minutes away from the hotel. If you want to go down to the shopping area and centre of Rome, it took 20 minutes to walk through the park and down the Spanish steps. This is not your typical 5 star hotel. It's charming and very Italian. I wouldn't order cappuccino for 6 euro at the restaurant bar unless you are desperate to have caffeine fix right away...but other than that, you can find most things you want around the surrounding area. It's settled on the edge of Villa Borghese residential and diplomatic community. I got cappuccino in the park for about a euro. The Prince Spa is probably what sets this hotel apart from everyone else. It is probably the best spa in Rome. This is my first review I have written on Tripadvisor. I had to say something because this hotel did not get the best reviews in the past. Maybe because they didn't have the spa...and maybe because this hotel is not your typical 5 star hotel. The staff is polite, calm, and elegant. I enjoyed working with Cosimo at the front desk. If you smile and try to communicate to the staff with respect, they will bend over backwards for you. This is not your hot spot hotels. There are no frills in the staff mannerism. If you need something like adapter for your phone charger, they will do their best to find it for you. Just ask politely and calmly. The hotel is moderately priced. Because I packaged it with my plane ticket, I was able to get the hotel for less than $200 per night with tax. That is much less than any 5 star hotel on Veneto. I'd recommend this hotel to those people who want a good night sleep away from the chaos and tourists. If you are into sports, outdoors, and walking, pick this hotel. You get to swim at an incredible indoor pool, workout at the state of the arts gym, run through the most beautiful park in Rome, and walk around the most prestigious neighborhood. Walking through Rome is the best way to see the city. The highlight of this trip was Galleria Borghese next to the hotel. The Cranach exhibit was incredible and the hotel concierge made the reservation for me. There is no glitz and glamor here. If you want that...you will be disappointed. For glitz and show...go to one of the 5 star on Veneto and pay double or triple per night. This hotel is understated, reserved, and quiet. Only those who want a comfortable, cultural, and peaceful vacation in Rome with proximity to the most incredible museum (Galleria Borghese) should book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but don't let that deter you.”
Reviews.Author: love2trave09
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Parco Dei Principi is in a quiet area, on the border of the Villa Borghese, and a two block walk to the Borghese Museum. It has an old-world feel, with a formal lobby and decor. Our room, which was on the small side, did not have a view of the park, but was very quiet. The bathroom was quite nice, and had thick robes, slippers, and more than ample bath products and towels, which were changed two times a day. The full buffet breakfast was included in our rate, but may not be standard with all reservations. It is quite a nice spread, with hot and cold options, but not inexpensive. The staff will gladly call you a taxi, or explain the public transportation possibilities, but for those who enjoy walking, most of the attractions of the city are 45 minutes to an hour away. The nice compromise is to walk one way and taxi back, so you get to explore some of the local streets and check out the shops and cafes along the way. There are some nice local restaurants a short walk from the hotel, so you don't need to go to some of the more popular areas every night. However, the concierge will make you dinner reservations at interesting places all over the city, if you want to explore other neighborhoods. Though the hotel is not centrally located, it is a lovely place to have as a base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel ripping you off for internet use!”
Reviews.Author: Bocanela
Reviews.Content: A hotel with a good and quiet location, very clean rooms, but with an innaceptable tax on using the internet (12 EUR for 1 hour), while others hotels offers this for free. Probably the management considers the internet a luxury and feel the urge to get some money out of this as well!!! The concierge staff was polite and helpful, but somehow bored, ending by forgetting once to make us a reservation for a sightseeing tour, a tour that, amazingly, they promote the moment you check in! As a result, we were waiting for ages in the lobby of the hotel, being assured that we'll be picked up by a car that never showed up. Instead, when we gave a phone call to the agency (Vastours), we discovered that the hotel didn't do any reservation and that we have to grab a taxi and go to Vastours where we could joined the other visitors. As a result, the morning we had to leave to the airport, we were afraid to use their wake-up call, thinking of the same neglicence!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis for a city break”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelUK75
Reviews.Content: Great sized room with beautifully fitted bathroom. Hotel was spotless with lovely swimming pool area. All food and drink was expensive but it was possible to put your own drinks in the mini bar fridge. Staff were friendly and helpful, though the housekeepers were perhaps a little over zealous and kept tidying up our things, which I didn't appreciate Overall, the location is ideal if you are prepared to walk 15-20 mins through the park or take a taxi and enjoy the feel of a resort whilst still being in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “No pool to use and very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: jonmclinch
Reviews.Content: I booked the Parco Dei Principi as the advertisement stated that there was an outside pool and also an indoor pool (opened in the Winter of 2009). When i arrived on 3rd October i was informed by the Hotel staff that the out door pool was only in use until end of September and that the indoor pool was not open until Monday 11th October. My stay was from 3rd - 8th so as a result we could not use either pool. I booked the Hotel to specifically use the pool. I was furious. We spent the entire 5 days wondering why we had booked the Hotel which is a 20 minute walk away from any sights. The staff were curt and unhelpful. I asked to use the internet to book my return travel passes and was told quite abruptly that there would be a charge. 35 cents a minute. A small lager was 9 euros and bottle of water from the mini bar 6 euros. I have lived in London for 30 years and travelled to many cities but Rome whilst beautiful took the buscuit!

Reviews.Title: “lovely !”
Reviews.Author: lol1
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic if you prefer to be slightly away from the hustle and bustle. Great recommendations from the concierge (in no way sending you to the most expensive place) - only disappointment is the pool was closed when the weather was glorious but hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: travelproEssex
Reviews.Content: I have often read reports about 5 star hotels that bemoan the cost of food & drink etc and this place is not cheap. But I have rarely if ever stayed at a 'proper' 5 star hotel where it is cheap because 5 star should mean great rooms, great service, great food and great facilities - which do not come cheap. Our stay was for 3 nights at €240 per night and we had several bottled beers, a couple of jars of nuts a coke some water and a bottle of wine from the minibar - total about €45. We also had breakfast on just one day at €15 each and a several drinks each night and our total extras bill was only €200 which I was comfortable with. So having got the cost issue out of the way I can say that we did n ot eat in at all so I can't speak about the food nor did we use the spa - but it looked superb. The room was fine the facilities (TV, balcony etc) good and although the bathroom was a little cramped the toiletries were excellent and it had it all - shower (2 heads) bath, bidet, toilet shaving/make up mirror, lights around the main mirror and so on. Robes and slippers included. The hotel is baroque with very fancy lounges, cornices, mirrors, statues, glass and drapes and the concierges were courteous and spoke great English. We took taxis twice a day to the sights such as the Vatican, Colosseum etc in the morning and then into town to eat and drink in the evening. The hotel is an oasis of peace and calm after the chaos of central Rome and sightseeing in 30 degrees heat. The pool and bar/snack bar is beautiful, never crowded and never populated by leery businessmen - more like the wives topping up their tans while hubby did the deals. Towels and comfy sunbeds a plenty and shades available everywhere. I had no complaints. I was expecting a significant upgrade as agreed with an Amex scheme and also through my travel agent but there were simply no rooms available so tough luck on us. It in no way spoilt our stay and I want to go back for a leisurely week in Rome now we have toured the major sights. Personally I think the hotel and staff had just the right amount of informality and formality, I enjoyed chatting to the barman late at night and the concierges were most helpful. The doormen were perfectly happy to call taxis for guests and never held out their hand for tips. Taxis took no longer than 3 minutes to arrive and varied in cost between €8 and €17 depending on how far they came to get you and what time on which day (late Sunday is most costly!) A thoroughly enjoyable stay. The weekend was expensive only because we taxied everywhere (to and from Ciampino airport is €55 each way) and took guided tours of the Vatican and Colosseum to avoid the 3-hour queues - the tours were about €50 each and lasted 3-4 hours with qualified and knowledgable guides. Rome was fabulous, the italians were brilliant, the food and wine excellent and the hotel pretty much perfect. Wouldn't mind all my trips abroad being like this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: CairoLATravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 2 nights to start our our honeymoon to Italy. The hotel was easy to get to from the airport-we just took a cab. When we arrived at the hotel, our room was ready which was great considering we arrived there at 9am. The room was really nice, very clean and with a nice balcony overlooking the pool & park. The room is not that big but apparently that's the norm in Europe. The bathroom could use a little updating though. The door to the bathroom was very awkward-you would have to walk around the door because it never really opened up completely. You have to pay for wifi so we ended up not using it. We were supposed to get free internet access but they told us that's only for connection to a computer with a cord in the room and not for wifi. The hotel is in a residential area which is very nice but be prepared to take a cab everywhere. The hotel front desk is helpful calling a cab for you. Otherwise they aren't too helpful. They seemed annoyed every time I came up to ask a question. There is a grocery store about 20 mins away walking distance which I suggest going to since the mini bar & the bar prices downstairs were really pricey. I don't think I'd stay there again. Next time I'd pick somewhere more centrally located. For the price we paid for the room, I wouldn't suggest it to friends either. It's nice but not nice enough to re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Happy too book again”
Reviews.Author: iwip
Reviews.Content: Had three rooms second floor that overlook swimming pool and park , at that level there is no view over the park , you would probably need the top floor for any extensive view as the trees have grown up so much, higher floor would be more expensive. It is a comfortable walk to the centre of Rome through the park , it is quite a small city and the better known visits , Trevi Fountains , Coliseum and Forum , Vittoriano , Spanish Steps etc are a short walkable distance ,if you were slighlty more energetic the Vatican is not far. My 83 year old father with a dodgy knee and damaged foot managed a walk to the centre and back on a hot day . You can walk out of the hotel veer right and then after about 40 yards left at the traffic lights and pick up a bus (tickets need to be purchased in advance from Tabacchi for most buses , although some are carrying machines that take Euro coins , not on routes to this hotel that I found) . There is also the tram system slightly further along the same road but this is a suburban based system that eventually ends up in the centre , you also have to change to get into the centre and seems frequent only at rush hour this far out. Bus numbers to catch are 52 (goes to a small sqaure near Trevi fountains and Vittoriana , 910 goes to train and bus termini in centre , use this for Coliseum etc and I think it was 227 all on same stop. Taxis , if you call a white taxi to the hotel , the doorman will call it for you , they will start the clock as they are called , they often show tarrif 2 when they arrive , ask them to change it to tarrifa uno , just point and say those words you will have the rest of the journey at the correct rate , you may be inclined not to tip them because they have already charged you too much by setting the wrong rate before they get to you. A taxi journey to the railway station (Termini ) is also the bus Termini and will cost about 12 Euro without bags , if you want to pick up a taxi in town the Termini is obvioulsy a good place to ensure no extra charges, about 15 euro with bags and three people. The Hotel is good , you have to remeber you are in a Capital city of the world , services and drinks and food will cost you more , whoever moaned breakfast was 17 odd euro for coffee and croisant , forgot to tell you that was for breakfast in the room . If you are daft enough to book room only you are going to pay highly for meals, but lets face it this is one of the cheapest five stars in Rome just because its set slightly out of the centre in the Emabassy area , so relatively is good value. Take the half board option , the breakfast is magnificent , with so much food you will never be stuck for choice , the fruit is freshly sliced with huge variety , bacon , eggs etc , meats , smoked salmon, sparkling wine ( not a bad one either) , yoghurts , cakes , cereal , fruit juices , bottled water , endless , as was the coffee , tea etc. You can exchange evening meal for lunch if you wish , the set menu for the evening meal does not change , it is fine for a week but beyond that would be a struggle if it does not completely change , only there for a week so I do not know if that happens. To eat in the hotel at night without half board is going to cost you from 24 Euros for dessert , about 35 for main and depending on your inclination one or two starters at about 20 euro, and I emphasise from. The food was good , particularly like the beef in balsamic vinegar , generous portion of fillet sliced , the pork one night was excellent and I should have returned it the next time I had it as it was not of a similar standard, pasta was good , it is not classic Italian food though. Excellent wine list , I judge lists by sampling nearly the cheapest wine to see if it is well chosen, in this case about 30 euro and it was very good , you could spend up to the price of a small car if you wished, even when I wanted just a glass of red they fetched a new bottle , opened it , offered it for tatsing and that is all I had , one large glass for which I was only charged 4 euro and it was very acceptable , not so sure they did not make a mistake on the charge. You always got a glass of free fizz when you were seated plus canapes , endless types of bread an olive oils as required , and very attentive service and attention to detail . Eating at the pool was more expensive than going inside to the bar and there was a slightly wider choice at the pool. Pool is excellent , pool staff will find you beds , lay out towels etc , if you wish. No charges for beds or towels as is the way in some Italian hotels. Decor is much more traditional than modern , oddly the photographs make it look very over the top , but it is better in reality than the pictures , someone described it as Liberace meets Louis XIV , if you like nothing but minimalist modern decor this is not for you. The Spa is not ready yet , but they seem to be spending a lot of money on it . Irons are not provided or allowed in rooms , fire regulations, so if you want laundry and pressing you are going to pay . The front desk is well staffed and they are very helpful and courteous , I suspect it can often be the way you ask that may determine the response you get , but I found them unfailingly polite. As an example I asked them about one missing robe for our room and two for the children plus a flat battery in one of the safes , with fifteen minutes everything was rectified ; one incorrect item on the final bill , which was simply down to my poor Italian , it was swiftly rectified and I left a very satsified customer . Just one pet moan, why do people think it is acceptable to turn up to a restaurant in the evening in shorts or tracksuit bottoms , I am sure they wouldn't like the staff to be dressed as such , I believe it is discourteous . Would book again without hesiatation.

Reviews.Title: “Opulence with Fantastic Pool”
Reviews.Author: mavenair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on our trip. I was a little worried before I arrived that the location would be far from everything but it was just a 5 or 10 minute taxi ride to many attractions in Rome, (8 to 10 euros). Considering the value and fact that it had a gorgeous outdoor pool I think it was a bargain. Any of the other 5 stars I researched were much more expensive. It was clean, and despite many of the reviews posted here I encountered no problems with the staff whatsoever. Indeed they secured advance tickets as soon as we checked in for the Colosseum and Borghese Gallery! Also when I emailed the concierge from my home in the US they were very prompt in replying. Rooms were a little small, but I didn't expect huge rooms in any hotel in Rome. There were balconies which was nice. Turndown and daily housekeeping were timely and efficient. Breakfast everyday (included) was a large buffet which included hot items as well as cold. Everyone spoke English and was very helpful. There is also a daily shuttle to the Via Veneto but one day we walked and it was a pleasant 10 minute walk. Note that there are no little shops around so if you want anything for your room bring it back after your sightseeing. We woke up everyday, had breakfast, toured, came back and hung by the pool until about 6, and then either took a taxi to a restaurant or walked to one they recommended. North Rome is lovely, it's a quiet, high end neighborhood which is a nice oasis in crazy Rome! Even with taking taxis twice a day, it was well worth staying in a five star hotel for the price. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but - beware of over-charging”
Reviews.Author: Well_travelled047
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grand Hotel Parco dei Principi early August 2010. The hotel is certainlly luxurious - rooms are excellent - exceptionally well-furnished and clean. Maid service is excellent. Swimming pool and surrounding area excellent. Concierges at reception were extremely courteous and helpful. I enjoyed my visit very much, however, I found leaving the hotel an unpleasant experience. On checking-out, I was over-charged for mini-bar plus breakfast, significantly. I requested an itemised bill and was told that this was not possible. The member of staff concerned was unpleasant and rude and was insistant that the charges were correct. I requested that the charges be reviewed and I was then presented with the correct bill. The hotel is beautiful and I enjoyed the visit, however I would not return. I left with a bad taste in my mouth following the rude behaviour of the member of staff above. I got the distinct impression of the hotel just wanting to take your money - not even asking if I had enjoyed the stay. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends, family or colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: blimp57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and having read countless reviews about Rome taxi drivers ripping off the unwary and the high cost of meals at the hotel, we decided to avoid any extra hassle by packing a few cartons of orange juice and some brioche for breakfast and pre-booking a Terravision bus on the internet from Ciampino airport to Termini station. The Terravision bus cost 8 euros return and after finding the location of the hotel on Google Maps we used it to give us walking directions from the bus station to the hotel. We're both 50 years old but reasonably fit and it took us less than half an hour with our wheely suitcases to walk to the hotel, so no problem and no hassle. When we got to the hotel it was absolutely lovely, with king-size beds freshly turned down every night, a big marble bathroom and a lovely private balcony overlooking the park (and we were only in one of their standard rooms). We had breakfast on the balcony every morning (free remember) and then strolled through the park every day to get to all the main attractions. If you're prepared to walk for half an hour to get to the centre, then this is a delightful place to be. After a long day, we would come back and swim in the pool, sunbathe for a bit and then stroll back into town to choose from one of the many restaurants. Aside from entry fees, the evening meals were our only big expense, but you can get a good meal for two with a bottle of wine for around 40 euros. So if you want to see Rome, come back to a lovely hotel and are prepared to walk a bit (or take a taxi if you prefer, but obviously this'll cost you) then we couldn't recommend this place more highly. It was my wife's fiftieth birthday, and it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff..pricey & odd”
Reviews.Author: Skippy_Sardine
Reviews.Content: Excellent location meters from Borghese and awesome concierge..all done with style & friendliness..not always found together in other places. stayed in Rome 30 plus Heat but for some odd reason they closed their superb pool @ 6pm...yet to try and work that out. rooms are nice although not kept in great condition a lot of the wood paneling needs some TLC...it is a high class hotel afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Faulty Towers with Disgraceful Service”
Reviews.Author: PJs_Review
Reviews.Content: I have typed out the letter i gave the hotel on the departure of our stay at the Parco Dei Principi. You should get the idea of how bad our stay was at this hotel. "Dear Parco Dei Prinipi Management, We write with regards to our dissapointing experiance over the last 7 days. We raised our issues with your front of house manager whom tried his best to mitigate the issues, however we felt it prudent to raise the issues with the senior management & expect compensating by our due departure at 6.00am We record our findings as follows; 1. The Spa was not available although advertised on the internet & this was the prime reason we booked this hotel. BEWARE the Spa is not available. 2. The internet in the room or hotel is not free and in a Five Star Hotel it should be. 3. The hotel does not provide an iron or ironing board and therefore forces the guests to use the hotel launry service which is ridiculously over proced. Absolutley disgusting. 4 Items of pressing came to 58 Euro. 4. In order to contact any member of staff for the 'rip off' laundry service it takes no less than '15 minutes' to contact either the front desk, conceirge or house keeping. Awful service. 5. On the first night the fire alam was ringing all night (why?) 6. On the second to last night the whole hotel was without water supply (why?) 7. The service at the pool is a disgrace. The only girl who works is 'Nico' the rest are lazy and ignorant. The food is not garnished and sauces etc are not provided. Service of a 1 star hotel and 24 Euro for 2 x cheese toasties is outragous. 8. The room service food is awful. Tastes like tinned food on a plate & not that of a Five Star hotel. 9. The room was not cleaned properly nor were enough toilet rolls provided throughout the stay. 10. The hotel conceirge booked expensive taxis rather than standard taxis. Note the meter starts on the taxi when the taxi is called and could be upto 10 euro starting price by the time you get in the car. A joke. The items above will be documented on Trip Advisor & other internet sites as the service recieved at the hotel was so bad. The hotel is a disgrace. It resembles no better than Faulty Towers & will never be recommended by ourselves" Also note on leaving we were charged for some drinks at the bar, 1 shot of Tia Maria (8.50 Euro) same for Vodka and same for Baileys. An absolute joke.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rome Experience, Great Pool, Superior Service, Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Coryate
Reviews.Content: We loved Parco Dei Principi. Excellent beautiful hotel with great service, a wonderful pool, and a suavy concierge who offered recommendations for true (delicious) Italian cuisine. Traveling with young children to Rome in summer can be difficult because the high temperatures (90 degrees +F) limit activities between 11 AM and 3 PM. The Hotel's pool was a wonderful attraction and respite in the heat of the day. The hotel and pool were special and made the rest of Roma so much more fun and enjoyable! Don't underestimate the reality of the heat. We saw attractions in the morning, headed to the Parco Dei Principi's pool when it got hot for a few hours, and then we visited more museums or activities in the cooler late afternoon. Then we followed the concierge's advice to taxi into Roma to eat delicious true Roma cuisine and walk the city. It was genuinely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Should Know”
