Reviews.Author: VictoriaD_1_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful, pool wonderful (watch out for non residents coming in on Sunday... too busy and less friendly), staff attentative, gym fine, bedrooms clean and spacious, a full meal in the restaurant was probably the best value of the week,food lovely and waiters were great,. We did not find the hotels situation an issue until we found there are no cafes or options available without transport. Piano and guitar lovely to listen to in the evening although lounge area was empty every night...... Be fully aware of what should be available to you when you check in, we were not assisted and had to ask everything thereafter.. We had continental breakfast 1st morning and again had to ask, totally over priced for anything else. Same for lunch etc, Business discussions in the afternoons took over the lounge area, if you want to experience Italian style this is the place to go but be aware if your ordinary joe expect equality but you might not get it , ,,,,,,,,,,and if you need to regard prices this is not the place for you to go, it is restful on the whole, tasteful and class but perhaps the latter can be an issue as we observed reserved seating for some at the pool, info being shared for some and not others, and at one point we were pointedly asked for our room number previous to an order being provided... something others around us were not asked to do.. , We had a problem with air conditioning and a terrible smell in our room and needed to be moved the next night which we were with no problem but no apology either...our first time in Rome not our first time in a 5 star hotel but the first time Ive felt I need to post info to give anyone considering a heads up. These comments were also reflected by others in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 star hotel with outdoor swimmingpool in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Marge4
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at Parco dei principi for three nights and had lovely time. First of all Rome is an amazing city. The hotel is very nice. We had great room with a balcony on the fourth floor overlooking the pool area and Villa Borghese. Rooms are spacious and nicely decorated and you will find a great selction of bath products from lovely fashion brand Etro in the bathroom. The hotel is situated just by the the lovely Villa Borghese (a big park where you find many great art museums and more it's also lovely place for walks and jogging.) It will take you approximately 15 minutes to walk to via Veneto or 20 Piazza di Spagna but it's a pleasant walk through the park. Grand hotel Parco dei Principi has it's own very nice pool and sundeck and poolbar which was absolutely great after a long hot day in Rome. The only complaint I have about this hotel are the prices in the bar/minibar they charge you 7 euro for a bottle of mineral water and 7 euro for a snack in the minibar. But overall we had very pleasant stay here

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice rooms but very classic...”
Reviews.Author: Ashaari
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice rooms but very classic hotel. Recommended for older people. The location in not bad, 15 minutes walking to the city centre (piazza barberini), and 25-30 minutes to piazza navona. So we had to ride taxis many times to get there. Service was very good, but nothing is free exept ice. Items in the mini bar were so expensive, as well as internet and laundry. But the staff were nice and so much helpfull. So i prefere a hotel near piazza barberini or piazza navona, but it will cost much more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a great pool area”
Reviews.Author: loulouSurrey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel. It is a 30 minute walk to the Spanish Steps across the park. You will therefore need to take some taxis if you are travelling with children in the summer heat. The food was good and alot of it. We couldn't manage all 3 courses at dinner due to the large helpings. The pool was a lovely bonus at the end of a hot day sightseeing. The spa was being renovated so I couldn't use that. Again beware of the extras - the milkshakes by the pool which my children were drinking by the dozen are 15 Euros each!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hermani
Reviews.Content: This 5 star hotel is located away from the noisy Roman life, just beyond the old city's gates directly next to the Borghese gardens. This hotel has everything that one would expect from a five star hotel. Beautiful settings with huge gardens and very large swimming pool. The most attentive staff one oculd expect. Large rooms with balconies. Very different than the other five stars hotels located on nosiy Via Veneto. One will need to take a taxi for less than 10 euros to get to the spanish Steps but will manage to sleep in silence and retreat to a cooler location and beautiful gardens after a hot day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially when in Rome in July”
Reviews.Author: Alma W
Reviews.Content: For a European hotel - the rooms in this hotel are spacious with plush slippers & robes. We had 2 connecting deluxe rooms with a corner terrace. We were overlooking Villa Borghese and had a spectacular view of the Vatican especially at night. The breakfast buffet is very hearty although after the 3rd day, the repeated menu got "old." When we requested for room service - they were very prompt. NOTE: There is no iron in the rooms and if you have an adapter - the 2-pronged converter can be used in an outlet in the bathroom. We did not find the staff to be rude at all - just your typical Europeans. As some others posted, the location is not in Central Rome. This is a blessing. During the hot July days we were there, the peace & quiet at Parco were appreciated. Also, after touring for several hours everyday - we all welcomed the nice huge (considering it is in Rome & outdoor) blue and deep pool. The pool, however, is not very kid-friendly and closes at 6:00 p.m. (which is quite odd given summer hours). It is not in Central Rome but you can easily walk to the Spanish Steps & Via Veneto (cutting across Villa Borghese) in 15-20 minutes. Also, taxi to the Spanish Steps or Piazza Navona is less than 10 euros. Taxi to the Vatican was 15 euros. Breakfast aside, food and drinks at Parco can be quite steep - just like any luxury hotel. But, all in all - worth the money for a great family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a hike, but Grand indeed”
Reviews.Author: R0adW0rrier
Reviews.Content: The Parco dei Principi was truly a highlight of our trip to Rome. We had heard that hotels in the city tended to be noisy, so we were careful to book one that was reportedly quiet. This one was so quiet, so cool, so dark (with its luxe velvet draperies) that we slept for 15 hours our first night (those overnight flights can be brutal, but even by those standards this was pretty outlandish.) The hotel is situated on the edge of the Villa Borghese -- the Central Park of Rome -- and the neighborhood is like the Upper East Side of Manhattan. Embassies, grand estates, etc. All that is fine, but it meant trying to find a little cafe or any other amenities in the neighborhood was a bit of a challenge. We did happen on a lovely street fair on Sunday, while looking for an open tabachi that would sell us bus tickets. We quickly discovered the #52 and #910 buses, which go into town, so during the day, that's a good option for cheap transportation, and you can walk to the Via Veneto in about 15 minutes. But the location is definitely out of the mainstream, so if that's important to you, you may want to look elsewhere. Taxis from centro storico cost about $10. That aside, the hotel itself was gorgeous in a grand style kind of way. Evidently, it's the fave spot for diplomats and even played host to the Beatles in their heyday. The staff is helpful, although the concierge can be a little imperious -- if you're not Madeleine Albright, I guess --- even though two of them boast keys from Les Clefs d"Or. The pool is spectacular -- think the Hotel Bel Air comes to Rome. A real plus during hot summer mid-afternoons -- and a rarity in an urban hotel. The place has a big conference center, but there's no free wi-fi evidently there's free wifi in the Villa Borghese, but we didn't try it out). There are little rooms where you can connect for about one euro for 3 minutes. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone willing to hike a little in the name of peace and quiet -- a fair trade-off, given how demanding a visit to Rome can be.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent room and baloney with view of St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: SafariAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was great and courteous! The hotel is close to the museum in the park with great original statues. Housekeeping was wonderful and friendly and went the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES!!!!”
Reviews.Author: montana12345
Reviews.Content: I booked on internet and was charged 3X the rate on their rate sheet! Unfortunately I found out at end of stay. And, nothing was included! I will never use a 3rd party booking service again! The hotel is worth no more than the dog house in my backyard! It's TIRED and TACKY! If you like coffee in the morning...17 euros for a cup and a croissant! Or, walk several blocks because there is NOTHING in the area! Need an iron? Must be done by them for... a pretty penny! No irons allowed in room! The sheets are starched (feels like) linen. i am surprised we did not wake up with scratches on our bodies! Next time I'd rather stay home and book a night in my dog's house where it's warm and cuddly and not cold and rude and I will surely not be taken advantage of!! Oh, they advertised spa opening in spring! Yeah, of what year? The gym is a DUMP! So glad to be home!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All my expectations were exceeded”
Reviews.Author: Sandy4385
Reviews.Content: After 5 months of planning for a family trip of 10 people ages 15-73, I had frequent concerns that my choice of hotel was not ging to be a great experience. I selected Parco after a TON of reading - my other considerations included all the Westin properties, the Sheraton and the Intercontinential to name a few...plus several smaller up-scale hotels. I opted for Parco mostly due to price, free breakfast, and the larger feel of the hotel (pool, dining room, lounge area). I was very concerned about "location" as many people indicated that the location was a negative. The reality --- EVERYONE was impressed and exceptionally satisfied! I'll start with location - my family LOVED the location. The park, which is directly across the street, is a great place to run or walk...or, as my mom experienced...to simply sit and watch the local flavor. You can actually walk thru the park to the heart of Rome. The walking time is about 25 minutes to the Spanish steps moving at a "city" walking speed. For those who did not wish to walk - the cab ride is $7 Euro and very easy to catch in both directions. The Parco is located in a quiet and peaceful setting. IT is relaxing to come back to a quiet hotel after a long day in Rome and just relax. Parco offered that each evening. The pool is lovely. The grounds are really very nice. Gelato, expresso, dining are all within 3-7 minutes of strolling. I was VERY happy to be located at this hotel. No complaints at all on location! The rooms - we all had basic "Superior" rooms (5 in total). 2 were actually upgraded to Deluxe which offers a park view. ALL the rooms had a balcony and a table with 2 chairs. All rooms had air conditioning which worked very well. Bathrooms were large by Europe standards and well apointed. The rooms vert very clean, well kept, and had a nice Roman charm. I saw nothing "run down" -- everything was impecable. Also --- all of our rooms (Floors 5 and 2) were very quiet. I am used to sleeping with ear plugs and found the rooms so quiet that I kept them out! Staff -- some people have noted that the staff is hit or miss. I found EVERYONE to be professional, kind and helpful. They also allowed us to all check in at 11:00 which was great after a long flight. Bar - great selections with outside seating. The inside lobby is lovely. Perfect place to relax at the end of a busy day. Breakfast - very nice in a wonderfully white dining room. Great bonus to have the breakfast! Price - we reserved in January for an end-of-May stay and locked in a rate of 210 Euro inlcuding breakfast and all taxes and fees. No other hotel that I researched could come close. With such a large group, the price really mattered --- so this was a real deal! I have to end by saying that I am very picky when it comes to my accomidations. When traveling without the extended family I always go high end - Ritz, Four Seasons, etc. I always thought of Parco as a family "compromise" and a place that I would not return to on my own. After this stay - I would seriously consider ONLY staying that Parco. I was really surprised by the rooms, the location and the staff. One tip -- Parco is a member of iPrefer. Register yourself as a member if you opt to stay here as it may get you an upgrade! Last note -- I thought the spa would be open when we arrived -- it was not! If that matters to you, check on the real opening date!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome, but beware....”
Reviews.Author: Snövit
Reviews.Content: Rome is the most wonderful city and some of the sights are within walking distance if you are a bit of a walker. Museum visits must be booked ahead, or you'll queue forever. Watch out if your ticket says 9.00-11.00, it means you get out at 11.00, not that you show up between 9 and 11. General attitude is not too friendly by museum staff, more like security people pushing crowds around. Same problem as France: banks will not split a €500 note for you "only for our clients". In restaurants you really have to watch out. In "Vladimiro" on Via Aurora we spent € 38 for a very simple lunch for two. When we objected another €5 being added for "Servizio", the waiter pointed to a large poster with menu and prices, and a tiny print in the bottom mentioning the service charge. Hotel Parco dei Principi: great rooms, very tidy. Not recommendable for allergies, plenty of drapes, thick carpets and textilecovered walls. Dining not so great, but very friendly waiters. I agree with previous posters about the front desk staff. Rather pushy on the taxibooking. When we left our taxi arrived way earlier than we wanted to so we felt like "now that you paid, get out of here". The ride to the airport cost us €55 when it should not be more than €40. Drivers excuse: booking costs extra. Allover we felt taken for a ride. Shopping: although I was ready for some serious handbag/shoes shopping, I lost my enthusiasm when encountering the salespeople. Again a feeling of being watched rather than helped. Why bother? I can buy the same makes at home in friendlier stores, selecting in peace and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “good service, out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: roma36669
Reviews.Content: The conceirge and front desk staff were cordial and had good recommendations. The location is a bit out of the way and necessitates a cab ride to most places. Note that unless you specify your room request , a single traveler may receive a small room with a twin sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor - like a European Palace! Hated the service, very 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: tourtheworld-74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of a large Corporate trip. We didn't chose it and didn't pay, so I can't comment on value for money. The outside belies the lovely decor inside! Personally I really loved the interior of the hotel. It was decorated in the theme of an Italian palace and the art work was all reproductions of all the art you see in the museums and galleries of rome. Much more character than a Hyatt, where you could be anywhere! Would I decorate my bedroom this way, no, but hey when in Rome..... We were upgraded to a suit. I liked the room and the lovely wall of cupboards down our entrance hall. The bathroom was okay. Small with no direct ventilation and the basin/vanity area had no room for your toiletries. The shower was very sensitive, and was over the bath. I liked the heated towel rail and the thick white towels. The suite was done in 2 rooms. One bedroom, one lounge. I did not at all like the decor of the lounge (old green courdroy lounge suite with tassels more reminiscent of an old British pub than Italian Palace) I also didn't like the separate rooms. Had we been travelling with kids, then great, a room for them. But for a couple the space was redundant. Now if they had broken the joining wall down - HUGE potential for a magnificent room! Each room had separate temperature control, although neither worked- the rooms were over heated, and after asking at reception to have it looked at (and it STILL didn't work) we opted to switch it off. The room had lovely thick blackout curtains and was quiet. It had a small balcony, which we didn't use, but could leave the doors open for fresh air. On the upside, let me say that the breakfast (continental) offered by the hotel was DIVINE and the best I have had in Europe! On the down side: Firstly the service. All of the hotel staff (mostly male staff) were terribly cool - and not as in funky, but as in eye rollingly sick of tourists. In the 4 nights we spent at the hotel the only friendly person we encountered was the chamber maid! Secondly, our dinner. We ate one set meal at the hotel, with the conference. It was absolutely awful and by far the worst meal of the trip (and that includes one pretty bad airplane meal!) Thirdly, the location is quite out of the way! Yes, it is a lovely walk through the park to the Spanish steps, but is a good 40 minutes! If you have a lot of sightseeing to do, plan on taking taxis (as the metro is further than spanish steps). Although the pool only opened 1 May, it did look lovely - and in the hot Roman Summer would be wonderful to lie around - if you had a very easy schedule! Although I liked the decor and the breakfast very much, at the end of the day I believe 5 star is about Service. As I rate service very highly I would not recommend this hotel. If the service changes (alot!) then this could be a wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Almost great”
Reviews.Author: rm124
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel over Easter. We booked a junior suite and a double room for the kids. We got a very warm and friendly reception, and they gave us two lovely rooms adjacent to each other with an interconnecting door. They were on the sixth floor overlooking the park (I think the seventh, top, floor is a bit more special!), both with big balconies for a city hotel. The views were stunning -across the park, over the tops of the trees, to St. Peters. Both rooms were really plush, a bit footballer's wives - which is fine by me. A few frayed edges here and there, but overall very very nice rooms. The restaurant was pretty good, but not fantastic. We stayed half board and discovered that all the half board guests, or perhaps the English ones, are all seated in a separate part of the restaurant. Don't know why, and I can't say it made any difference to us. I would say though that if we hadn't have been half board we probably would only have eaten there once, it's about 30 euros per course minimum and wine ranges from about 35 euros to the price of a small car. As it happened, we ate there twice. The first evening the service was absolutely faultless, prompt food - all four at the same time, friendly and courteous waiting staff all over us, a sommelier who was only too happy to give his time and opinions. We had a great evening. The second time we ate was a bit of a different experience, but it was Easter Sunday, so perhaps the regular staff weren't working. It was very disorganised, the staff were off hand, and the food wasn't great. In other words it was everything that the first night wasn't. This is the only reason I gave 4 for service. In the evenings the beds were turned down, curtains closed, lights down and slippers by the bed. However, the walls aren't that thick, and we could hear most of what went on in the corridoor, not to mention in the couple's room next door. Our showers were quite small, and (minor gripe) didn't have a light in. We discovered a towel in the toilet and a couple of toilet rolls lying around one afternoon when we came back, and a part of the shower door was hanging off, and then disappeared. Hardly the end of the world, and I didn't feel the need to complain, just not quite what you'd expect. Oh, and it's very close to the "BioPark", I think it's called, which seems to be some sort of mini zoo. This means that when you open your balcony door you can hear elephants and monkeys and birds screeching. Didn't bother us at all, it's a lot better than traffic - which we heard virtually none of. All in alI I think you get what you pay for, and it is a very nice place. It just felt like it was never quite what you'd expect it to be, almost but not quite. This hotel is cheaper than all the other 5 star hotels in Rome that I looked at. We once stayed in the Regina Baglioni, which is more expensive - and to my mind justifiably so. I might go back, and subject to telling them all of the above, I'd definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised and run by rude people”
Reviews.Author: MNBF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of honeymoon prior to flying back to Australia as we wanted a little luxury with some spa treatments. We had previously been to Rome so did not mind that we were not in the centre beside all tourist attractions. From the minute we arrived, all the men behind the main desk were just rude, unhelpful and gave a bad impression. We had just spent over a week in Italy where we stayed in 5 star hotels and everyone was so wonderful in all our other hotels so it was a bit of a shock to receive the reception that we got. Room was ok and hotel lobby ok - nothing spectacular. All our other 5 star hotels in Italy were much nicer. The hotel is at least 30 mins away from central Rome where most of the attractions are. So if you plan to be a major tourist and see lots then definitely dont stay here. One final point, they advertise themselves as a hotel/spa, when we stayed at the end of March 2010, the spa is still being built. I was looking forward to some nice relaxing treatments before boarding the long flight to Australia - none were available

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but highly unethical management”
Reviews.Author: confab
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel twice before and wanted to visit again in April. Six months prior to my trip I emailed and asked the cancellation policy. I was told by email that it was 24 hrs notice, and I booked the very next day. When I was forced to cancel, I was told that no..it's not 24 hours....there is no cancellation allowed at all. I lost over $2000 which had been taken from my visa. Mr Fazzolari, the manager's attitude is that I should get lost. As I said, a lovely hotel, bu it is managed by a bunch of crooks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest...”
Reviews.Author: pabel1
Reviews.Content: I was on business in Rome and had the pleasure of staying at the Parco Dei Pricipi. The service was outstanding and the room very well kept. I found the Pauline Borghese restaurant to be one of the best in Rome. Their sommelier was outstanding in his approach and recommendations. It was a wonderful stay. The location is also near the Borghese Gardens and is a very peaceful place to spend some time. The Borghese Museum (one of the best in Rome) is within a very short walk. I give this hotel very high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Parco dei Principi- Rome's Last Affordable Five-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HowieKlein
Reviews.Content: Normally I prefer to rent apartments or houses when I visit a city for any length of time-- as I did during December in Rome. (Take a look at this post I did on the whole experience: http://aroundtheworldblog.blogspot.com/2010/01/where-to-stay-in-rome-and-albania.html/). But after some time in Rome I went to Albania and then returned to Rome for one night before flying on to the UK. That meant a hotel room. The hotels I've stayed at in the past-- when my company was paying the bills (I'm retired now)-- are outrageously priced. A travel agent found me the one 5-star deal left in Rome, the Parco dei Principi up next to the Borghese Gardens, a quick jog from the fantastic Borghese Gallery, and just a short walk to the Spanish Steps. Although my friend described it as "Louis XIV meets Liberace," it really is an elegant and luxurious place to kick back. They need to get some Wifi in the rooms but otherwise, it's just fine-- and goes for about half of what similar hotels go for in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer bliss”
Reviews.Author: redbus
Reviews.Content: I absol adored this hotel, we had a suite which probably made a huge difference was just an amazing romantic trip that i will never forget. Hotel was very clean and just as i had expected they had very high standards and cannot fault in any way.. was near the Vatican City which you could see out of the balcany and although we didnt spend that much time in the hotel as we had a lot of sight seeing to be doing, what time we did spend in the hotel was lovely. Bed was very comfortable, hotel facilities was first class and dining room was although quiet was very Romantic and catered for our every need.We can honestly say we will be going back there in the early part of the year! Fantastico!!

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend staying at this fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: VolkerSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay in this wonderful deluxe hotel. It is close to all of the major attractions yet it is tucked away in a quiet, park-like setting. Rooms have great views over the park or the city. The hotel is very well managed. The staff is professional, helpful and curtious. The restaurant is is excellent. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet service which was served in a stunning, bright mediterranean setting. We highly recommend this unique urban oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, good location, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: iolanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights from 1st-5th October, paid only 3, as the hotel had a 4 nights for the price of 3 offer. We had a delux room on 5th floor with view over Borghese Park.The view was splendid and the room clean though a little worn out. When arrived I asked to change the first room given, as it was much smaller than the rest of rooms (visible on the hotel map) and the recetionist (in very italian manner) said Oh, it's late now, you can come tomorrow. After me yelling for about next 15 min they eventually changed it and the rest of stay was just fine.Breakfast was decent and hotels staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories assured!”
Reviews.Author: Tedd007
Reviews.Content: This is a first class operation from check in to check out. The staff is friendly, attentive and professional. The Deluxe Suite is well worth the rate, plenty of room to spread out and relax. Very well finished with incredible views. I never thought I relax in a bath and look out the window at the Vatican! Everything is easily accessible from their location. I recommend a walk through the The Piazza del Popolo on the way to the Castel Sant'Angelo. The view is amazing from the top.

Reviews.Title: “Less than 5 star....”
Reviews.Author: mcdkaty
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our stay here-after a very stressful year we were finally going to get a little time a way to go to a friends wedding-we wanted to pamper ourselves with a little luxury and spa treatments and this sounded like it would fit the bill...Absolutely wrong!! First of all, the SPA-is not opened yet, not that you would know that from their website-oh but they do have a gymnasium....so not what we were looking for-beyond that the room (we had a junior suite) was lovely but not like an American junior suite in terms of size. The location is really too far from all the main attractions in Rome which forces you into a taxi situation-this can get a little pricey. As far as the service at the hotel...with the exception of Sergio, who went out of his way to offer services. there is nothing 5 star about it. The breakfast buffet was OK, in general the staff was at worst rude and at best non friendly. Having stayed at 5 star hotels in the US this was not even close-most make it a point to know your name and room number-on most occasions when we came back to the hotel we were barely acknowledged. The icing on the cake was when we were leaving my friend had gone to the desk to say we would be checking out-just had to pick up our luggage (no offer to send someone up to help us) and asked if she needed to do anything about the bill-they told us what was on it and said no problem. As we are standing outside getting our luggage into the taxi one of the workers comes running out yelling that we have not paid our bill and can not leave yet...we were mortified-imagine all the people looking at you as if you are trying to skip on a bill, which by the way the balance was 94 Euro....that was it-we could not get out fast enough....Very disappointing overall-but beyond that the rest of our trip was wonderful!! If you are going really check where you are staying and its exact location compared to what you want to see....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ChaplinTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. Whenever we mentioned where we were staying in Rome to the locals (ok mainly taxi drivers) they all raised an eye brow and said that it was a very nice hotel - they werent wrong! The junior suite which we had booked was beautiful - ornately decorated with fine furbishments - a huge double king bed and a lovely lounge area and balcony with a view of the vattican. The best thing about this hotel (apart from the olympic size pool) was the food. The food is absoutely divine and the service was equal to match it. Everyone made a special effort to make us feel very welcome and the restaurant service was mega effecient. I would barely have time to sip my water and put the glass down on the table before I found a waitor topping it up - we felt like royalty. Being on half board - meant we could treat ourselves from the luxurious menu and the extensive selection enabled us to try new and exciting treats each night. We dined most nights at 7pm when the restaurant opened and so we received very good service as there were very few guests eating when we did, but as the restaurant filled up the water topper-upperer took a few extra seconds to reach our table. The breakfast buffet choice was great. Ok so you wont get your british fried breakfast here, but you wont be disappointed by the wide selection of cereals, meats, cheeses, fruits, yogurts etc. The only negative comment, is that the hotel is quite a way out of the city centre so if you are there for the city tourism you will need to get a taxi everywhere as its too far to walk - especially during hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard to be a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmanka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights in August 2009. Our room (and bathroom) were quite small. It was impossible to close the bedroom window (which was overlooking the street) . The buffet breakfast was fine provided you had breakfast before 9:30 AM. The breakfast lasts until 10:30 AM but if you come after 9:30 AM you will have the left overs as they do not seem to replace the food (e.g. no more cakes, small goods and smoked salmon). One day, when I asked the waitress if they would bring some more food, she dismissed me with sarcasm as if I was a spoiled child. When booking a taxi back to the airport make sure they do not order their special De Luxe taxi service that will cost you at least 25 Euros more than a normal taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: MartLeeds
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in July 2009 with my wife and 8 year old. Found to rooms clean, very well decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is lacking in choice especially on the hot side, the service was inconsistent and the coffee…well awful. However my son loved the hot chocolate. The offer we found included dinner which proved to be a very convenient as there are few other options within walking distance. The food was excellent. The pool is large and garden area nice and always clean. It’s not heated, so it took a few seconds to get used to. The staff we friendly and helpful. There is a small gym which was OK. The only downside to this hotel is the location. There is a courtesy bus to/from the top of the Via Veneto but it was unreliable, so we walked though the Villa Borghese each day. This took us around 15mins. The park is very nice but I wouldn’t risk it after dark At the bottom of the park is a small shopping centre with a good supermarket and a more convenient way through to the Spanish Steps. We liked this hotel. You need to consider the location if you want to be out in the centre at night but it’s worth for the pool and evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SurreyEnglandUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in July 2009. Functional exterior appearance but lovely inside. Great views from 7th floor. Lovely pool and grounds. Good food and service. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: CamiRo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for a 3 night stay to find that our booking had been cancelled ‘in error’ by Book in hotels. Because of the G8 summit the hotel was fully booked, however the front office manager, Cosimo Alterio went out of his way to help us. He did manage to accommodate us for the first night, he checked availability at the nearby hotels and made several phone calls that day and the next to Book in hotels. His service was above and beyond expectations. As for the hotel charming and aristocratic yet with all modern cons, we absolutely loved it. For those who think is too far from the main attractions, these are only 5-10 minutes away in a taxi and the fare is less than 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: coolbea2002
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel as I was visiting my sister who lives a 2 minute walk away from the hotel and I wish I hadn't! From the moment I arrived at the front desk I should have taken the lack of a welcome greeting, the sloppy manner in which we were dealt with, the lack of being offered help to take luggage to the room as a 'get out' sign but I persisted as I thought we all have 'off-days'. The breakfast was pathetic (minimal and hot food was cold), the front desk staff never warmed up above zero, the bar during the day is a disaster (you need to wait as the bar man chats to a colleague for 20 minutes before coming over to ask whether you would like to order a drink), the price of €27 for wifi access is a rip off. When one books into a hotel which claims to be 'luxury' you are prepared to pay for those little extras but this is a hotel passing itself off as luxury and there is no comparison with other hotels of the same category in Rome for example the Eden, Hotel de Russie, Baglioni. In fact if you wish to stay in a hotel in this area of Rome I would suggest the Villa Aldobrandini - 5 minutes from Villa Borghese. Unfortunately, it may be an upmarket area but the pavements are covered with dog poo (even the owner of the hotel allows his dogs - who are walked by his house staff, foul the pavements in the vicinity willy nilly - what is it with Romans and their dogs, have they never heard of scooper poopers?). I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, EVER!

Reviews.Title: “A Tranquil Setting, Very Comfortable and Quite Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Turlendu
Reviews.Content: I was in Italy for a leisure/business trip inspecting hotels and securing partnerships for my luxury wine and culinary travel company (CORK & FORK). As such, I stayed in several five-star hotels (others to the North) and inspected a number of others including some of the grande dames in Rome such as the Hassler, the Splendide (sister property to this one), the Eden, the Majestic, etc. In my view, Parco dei Principi holds up very well to these other luxury properties. Let me address the location issue first. Instead of viewing this as an out of the way location, I actually view the hotel as sitting in an oasis in an otherwise very busy city. The hotel certainly is not located in the center, but the very upscale residential area that it is in is quite peaceful. The view from our rooms over the Villa Borghese to the dome of St. Peter's was memorable. The peace and quiet is a marked contract to what one might encounter walking out of the front door of the Hassler (where one is greeted with a throng of tourists at the top of the Spanish Steps). There are no other hotels in the immediate area, which I prefer. Compare this to the Via Veneto, which is one hotel after the other and a very touristy area (albeit, upscale). Parco dei Principi does offer a free shuttle to the Via Veneto from 10-7 (starting at 9 would be nicer!) and indeed it is a 20 minute walk to Trinite dei Monti at the top of the Spanish Steps. The park is quiet nice. We took about 5 cabs from the center and it was always 10 Euros or less and quick. The exterior of the property is contemporary and a bit ugly. The interior is completely in the classical style. The lobby is quite large and we found the reception staff and the concierge to be quite helpful (realizing that Italians can be rather vague with directions!). The breakfast buffet, included in our rate, was great and one can sit on the ground floor terrace overlooking the gardens and some sort of ruins/old wall. The peace and quiet of this spot was quite enjoyable. Our room was quite nice..no issue with climate control, size, or anything else. I might wish for a bit more color in the decor as it was dominated by gold and green, but that's really a minor comment. The pool was about to open and is quite nice as it is set in the hotel's large garden. The fitness center is much larger than what I saw in any other five-star hotel. Other than emabassies and other residences, there is little to speak of in terms of retail in the area. There are a couple ATMs within 2-3 blocks, which was helpful. On the last night, we actually wanted a local restaurant. We were referred to Casa Mia, an informal Osteria-type spot which actually was one of our finest meals in Rome. While the view was quiet nice, the view from the Eden, the Hassler and the Splendide was better, but one will pay for that. Net, net: I definitely believe this is a five-star property (to counter a couple posts I read). Even if you are only in Rome for 1 night, the cab ride to the center really is quite short and certainly won't break the bank and you will be rewarded with peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth the cost. Mixed service.”
Reviews.Author: InterFC1
Reviews.Content: Okay... I am writing this review a couple of years after staying here but from what I have read of the recent reviews, I think it's safe to say that this is still relevant. My wife (at that time, my fiance) and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in November of 2006 on the way back to Sicily from the US. Found a good price on a travel website and we were content considering that it was a 5 star in Rome. The hotel is elegant in a certain way but definitely could use some type of renovation. I can certainly understand the desire to keep a classical feel to the place, but there is classical done well and then classical that is just old, and some features of the hotel - especially the rooms - were just old (i.e. furniture). The pool was out of use being November, so I guess we missed out on one of the best parts of the hotel (considering other reviews). The breakfast buffet was included in the price and was adequate but nothing impressive; certainly not indicative of a 5 star hotel. I gave this hotel an overall rating of 3 stars but was debating whether to give it 2. The service was subpar for anywhere and especially for a 5 star place (I know that I continue to harp upon the 5 star rating, but if you pay for 5 stars, you expect 5 stars and you paragon to hotels of similar ratings, right?). There was one young man there from Sardegna who was extremely kind and considerate but some of the others seemed like they were doing you a favor if they provided you with assistance. I am certainly not the typical naive American traveler (I live in Italy, am married to an Italian, speak fluent Italian, etc.), but you wouldn't have been able to tell from the treatment. There was one man in particular behind the front desk who was extremely rude (foreign name; was not Italian). I recall on one occasion that I had just worked out in their small gym and was sweating a little as I crossed through the lobby to go back to my room (there was no shower or changing facility in the gym), and this guy began to criticize me for doing this. I made sure to get in his face about it and he quickly backed down (I am 6'4" and weight 230 of muscle), but the audacity to even address me about this was ridiculous. Even the recommendations from some of the staff for dinner and that kind of stuff was less than adequate (with the exception of one evening). Bottom line is that this is a 3 star hotel disguised as a 5 star. I would not recommend spending 300 euro a night or whatever it was to stay here. There are better hotels in Rome for 100/night and you can spend the money on other things.

Reviews.Title: “OK...Not for the hip crowd”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleWings
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and the bathroom was much larger than typical European hotels (which is why I rated it three stars). The location is east of the Villa Borghese (one of Rome's nicest outdoor parklands). It's a solid 10-15 minute walk to reach the old city walls (and another 10 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps). Probably the nicest thing I can say is that it's an old-fashioned hotel - right down to the decor. Said in a bit less flattering way, it's a bit stuffy and stogy and probably a place your grandparents would be quite happy. For 'young and hip' people, it's very overpriced, poorly located, and not much fun. The workout room was not very impressive (it looks much nicer in the photos). On the positive, most of ther hotel employees seemed very nice. If you are traveling in warmer months, it has an Olympic sized outdoor pool - which I'm sure is a big hit when warm enough to swim. Our room also had a small balcony. Unfortunately, we weren't able to enjoy either due to the cold November weather. My wife thinks it's a 4 star...but... Bottom line: you can do much better for your money (unless you have a ton of extra cash and want to meet other grandparents).

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one day following our Med. cruise this September. The hotel is impressive and so was the service. Rooms were well equipt, large, clean, and there was even a small balcony. We received great service from the concierge, bell staff. They took great care of our considerable amount of luggage. We enjoyed the gratis breakfast buffet, and our lunch at the pool bar. However, if you want to see the sights of Rome, this is not the place to stay!! Although we found Rome very walkable, the distance from this hotel to the sights was too great (15E cab ride) to walk from the hotel in the short time we had. For that reason alone, and if you are planning on walking Rome, I would recommend a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned ridiculously expensive hotel in out of way location”
Reviews.Author: dss321ku
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10.30 p.m. after long journey. We unloaded luggage from taxi without help and we were given directions to room but no offer of help with baggage. Every time we left or returned to hotel there was no greeting or acknowledgement. Hot breakfast buffet items were cold all 4 mornings we were there. Good pool and attendant but every time something annoyed us about hotel we had to keep asking each other “Are we really paying nearly 400 Euros a night for this place?” It is probably resting on its laurels as a hotel for cruise ship guests and conference attendees .If you are coming to this great city you must be able to do better than this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelgalle
Reviews.Content: When in Rome stay at the Grand Hotel Parco Dei Principi. Service was flawless and the staff went out of their way to be informative, friendly and to make you feel at home. Everyone was great. The hotel is close enough to all of Rome, but it is located in a upscale beautiful area. This hotel has a wonderful outdoor pool and garden. The pool staff was very attenative with drinks, food, towels and even helped my husband out of the pool(he had a leg injury). The hotel lobby and rooms had a very old world,warm interior and and well maintained. Within walking distance there is a casual,lovely restaurant called "Fiore Di Zucca". The food and pizza were fabulous. We eat there two times and we felt like locals. Before I booked this hotel I read a few mixed reviews. You can stay here with confidence. I am glad I selected this hotel. In fact I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Remote”
Reviews.Author: Tresc0
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this hotel and Rome - 5 days in the first week of August. Previous reviews on the hotel are both fair and accurate. The mundane exterior of the hotel hides inner opulence in the public areas and to some extent in the bedrooms. We found the conceige service slightly indifferent with no-one really willing to go out of their way more than they had to. Our hotel bedroom was large, very comfortable with excellent air conditioning. Though the bathroom had a bath with shower over and was otherwise well equipped it was pretty pokey in size measuring no more than 6ft x 12ft. Our advice would be to ask for a bedroom overlooking the swimming pool/garden which offers views across Borghese Gardens towards the Vatican and was in sunshire throughout the day. We were notified by the travel company pre arrival that the indoor pool and spa were closed from August to November but as is often the case basically had to go with it! We were however more concerned on arrival to find the hotel shuttle bus had been suspended given comments by others about the 20 minute walk into the city and potential incurring of taxi fares. Again it was very matter of fact - the hotel shuttle isnt working as the driver is on holiday so tough. The town was a 20-25 minute trudge each way to get into the town and with August temperatures of 30c + you were basically lathered with persperation before you even got into the town centre. It may be the time of the year and temperatures but the Borghese Gardens didnt live up to expectation - basically acres of woodland with threadbare grass and huge amounts of graffitti and damage. The park was frequented by more police than tourists probably due to a recent initiative (reported in Sunday Telegraph 10/08/08) to stamp out crime by vagrant communites following a recent murder. Breakfast in the hotel was fairly average with little variety and included standard fare of cold meats/cheeses/fresh fruit salad/fresh fruit. The only hot fare available was scrambled eggs and bacon pre prepared in large metal tureens. Regrettably as we were on half board we were disappointed and surprised that the evening meal menu remained static throughout our stay. Whilst there were options for starter, main course and dessert it soon became pretty repetitive though the quantity and quality was very good. If you are there for only one or two nights or try it as an alternative to eating outside the hotel it would be pretty good albeit quite expensive. Each evening we were given complimentary flutes of Cava to start the meal, and complimentary glasses of dessert wine to end the meal, additionally the waiters provided olive oil from different italian regions to savour with your bread which was a really nice touch especially for someone like us on only their second visit to Italy. In closing quite a good hotel especially if you want a pool and to be away from the chaos of the city in a relatively quite suburb. But be prepared to either hike into town or pay for a taxi if the shuttle isnt running. As far as Rome is concerned I would highly recommend it though be aware of the high temperatures and humidity in August. The Vatican is a must. We travelled from the city centre via Metro (one euro each way) and found the trains very easy to use, quick and clean although as you would expect quite congested at peak times. Separately we took an open top red bus tour having used similar in Paris, but found the Rome version no-where near as good. Though it tours the sights it does so at speed presenting no photo opportunities. We found some difficulty in trying to co-ordinate the audio guide with the sites that you were looking at and more importantly found that once we had got off at a stop we had to walk some 20 minutes to a less popular tourist sites to get back on as they were all full. The red bus clearly feels no obligation to get you back on a bus once they have taken your money and it was only at the 3rd attempt that we got on a bus. Finally for any cat lovers - you MUST visit the cat sanctuary at Torre Argentine situated on the corner of Via Florida and Via Arenula. Free admission between noon and 6pm where you will see the fantastic work of Silvia Viviani and her supporters in caring for the homeless cats of Rome. A good experience in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: chilternwelshman
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business conference in Jun 2007 and added an extra day to top up my memories of Rome. If you want to be in the centre of the city, with its hustle and bustle, noise and polluted air, this is not the hotel for you. It is in a quiet spot close to the zoo. My room with a balcony had a view over the pines of the Borghese Gardens across to St Peter's, with spectacular sunsets. The first drawback to the cooler, cleaner, quieter location is that you have a 20 minute walk through Gardens to get to the top of the Via Veneto or the top of the Spanish Steps - but not at night, when a taxi or public transport (easy to use in Rome) is necessary. The other drawback is the lack of dining alternatives close by. Don't misunderstand: the hotel restaurant is first-rate, as are the tasty and generously-sized bar snacks - but neither is exactly cheap and a locl alternative would be welcome for those who might not want to face a trip down to the city. The hotel is a typical example of the traditionally-furnished and equipped grand hotels to be found in Italy. It is not cheap, but it is tasteful and well appointed, both in the public areas and in the rooms and bathrooms, and the staff are pleasant and helpful. Nothing to fault. A good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A really great stay”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller05
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the hotel a few years before and were uncertain as to whether it would be as good as it had been then. It was, and more so - friendly, welcoming and with a real attention to the needs of the guest you find in very few hotels nowadays. When we rang to book, they still had us on the computer, apologised for not being able to give us the room we liked before, but gave us a better and bigger one for the same price. The exterior of the hotel building is boring, but surrounded by lovely gardens and a pool area. The rooms are luxurious, well-maintained and clean, and the staff trained to think of what you might need and do it almost before you ask - the pool attendant arranged the parasol to give you perfect shade if you wanted it, and laid out the towels on the lounger. As another reviewer wrote, the mattresses are a bit hard, but the bed enormous - and the hotel sorted out the hardness problem with some extra blankets under the sheet. Breakfast was good, and the staff helpful. The restaurant prices for dinner are over the top, and we ate out - the hotel is a bit of a trek from the centre, and in our first stay, we clocked up large taxi fares. This time we figured out how to use the buses, which took us into and from the centre in 10 minutes (not least as the drivers were obviously practising for the Italian Grand Prix). It would be a help if the hotel could stock bus tickets. Otherwise, it was a pleasant 20 minute stroll through the park. The hotel was a marvellous retreat from the heat and bustle of Rome, and we felt a real sense of peace when we got back each night. Not cheap, but we left feeling that we had got something for our money - the hotel really made our holiday in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: xhosaswife
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of anything outstanding about this hotel. The staff, amenities, and room all lived up to the expectations I would have when paying this price for a room. We didn't use the pool, which is a nice amenity for families. The gym was a little small and when there were five people working out at the same time, it was a little crowded. The concierge staff was capable: arranging admission tickets, making dinner resservations, and hiring cars. The location is a little out of the way and everyone recommended that we not walk through the park in the evening, which means you are catching a cab back from the Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for a weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tiboparis
Reviews.Content: Parco dei Principi has a morden architecture but a neo renaissance decor inside that give him lot of charm. The hotel overlook the Villa Borgese gardens. You must book a room with view, with chance you will see the St Pierre Dome and you may hear in the morning the animals from the Zoo near by. Rooms are very well equiped, very nice bathrooms and amenities. Other facilities include a very nice swiming pool (be careful if you have outside guest a charge of 60 euros apply). An interesting wine bar in the lobby with a somelier shop is a must to visit. My only concern about this hotel is the front desk/Concierge service, not really friendly and smily...

Reviews.Title: “In a beautiful area of Rome, service was top notch!”
Reviews.Author: cburwick
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended we stay here and we loved it! It was next to Borghese Park and in a beautiful upscale location. The staff was very accomodating. We enjoyed the pool, the service staff, the breakfasts. It was lovely. I found the bed to be slightly hard, but nothing that prevented us from getting a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: tabithaEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from Easter Monday and can't recommend Rome highly enough.The hotel location was perfect for us.We enjoyed the walk through the park every day and the view across Rome that we were rewarded with at the far side.We had a junior suite( with a fantastic view to St.Peters) which was kept exceptionally clean with fresh bedding and even fresh dressing gowns every day.However,the climate control allowed only for hot or hotter and no one seemed to be able to alter this.All reception could do was turn it off completely or else we had to sleep with the windows open. We were on half board and herein lie the mixed feelings that we came away with.We both have special dietary needs and the chef did a fantastic job of providing tasty and interesting meals for our stay.The service on our first night was very helpful and polite.From there on it went downhill with a different waiting team on the following nights.Our waiter was surly,disinterested, forgot anything we requested,tried to cut out courses,lost wine left from previous nights - I could go on.It was like watching Manuel in Fawlty Towers.It made for interesting evenings( and sometimes quite frustrating) and we felt that perhaps half board customers are seen as second class guests against those paying the very high prices ad hoc.If I were to recommend this hotel I would say eat out or else be prepared to sit back and watch a farce!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet hotel in a very busy city!!”
Reviews.Author: rwsg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this amazing city. Stayed at hotel for 5 nights with our children aged 11 and 12, and my parents. Perfect if you want peace and quiet after a day in the noisy city! It is a good 20-25 minute walk to The Spanish Steps, but the hotel do offer a free minibus transfer throughout the day. The rooms and housekeeping were excellent. We had booked half-board, and would recommend you do the same if you want to eat-in. The food was gorgeous but would have cost a fortune if not included! Great choice of wines available.Waiter service was superb. NOTE: The restaurant is shut on Sunday Evenings, so if on half-board, choose either lunch or room service on that day. Reception staff and conceirge very helpful and made us feel very welcome. They were happy to give maps with directions, arrange taxi's, airport pick-up, etc. Live pianist every evening made the lobby area/bar a very relaxing place to be. The views over the park with St Peter's in the distance made it worth the extra travelling. There are no shops or restaurants in the immediate area, it seemed to be mainly Embassy buildings. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very Romantic Place!”
Reviews.Author: dinkyninky
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 5 days around New Year 2008. Really enjoyed or stay, we hava superiour suite on the top floor with amazing views of the park, and the rest of rome, including the Done of St Peters. We had champagne and petit fours in our room - not sure if that was included in the price or not but it was lovely! I have no idea what the hotel cost but it seems expensive. Breakfast was great, they had everything at the buffet, good service, fresh tea and good coffee. Lovely dining room. Not being used to 5-star hotels I foujnd this place opulent (maybe the lobby is a bit OTT/intimidating!) and luxurious. Very comfortable suite, comfortable bed, room was cleaned twice daily, with turn-down service. the suite was large, as was the bathroom, which had a seoerate toilet/bath/bidet room, and a twin-handbasin/shower room. Heated towels, bathrobe and sliiper, the lot. And when they turn down the bed they lay out your slippers next to on a special mat! the room was a bit overheated, and we kept the doors of both balconies open at night - even in december. I had a great experience at this hotel - most of the staff were fantastic, all the concierge staff were wonderful for ordering taxi's taking care of our luggage etc. (and no, they didn't provide us with a shuttle to get to the train station but they did of course call us a taxi. which was as much as anyone could reasonably expect!) Taxis not too expensive. Location is a bit off the beaten track but there is a tram around the corner which takes you right down to the vatican, its a nice trip, about 20 minutes. its about a 20 minute walk to the spanish Steps, or 5 minutes in a taxi. the great thing about being up here is the peace and the green green park. id say that's fantastic in summer time. I would not reccommend Rome as a destination for new years - though maybe if you hung around a hotel it would be different. we spent the eveining in the city centre walking around, soaking up the atmosphere, hoping tosee fireworks, music etc. It was a bit like a war zone all; right. not for the faint-hearted - everyone was throwing their own firworks around the place, it was unsupervised and unsafe, and we saw several ambulances! My partner propsed to me on the balcony of our suite at night - very romantic!! (I said yes!). Top location for this.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome, adjust your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Zoefilms
Reviews.Content: There were positives, the pool especially, which was much needed for an overheated 9 year old, not to mention his parents... BUT there's something kind of ludicrous about the anti-climax of the so called great European hotels. Especially the Capital City Continental ones The rooms were basic, although they did have gold inset crown molding and deeply patterned burgundy wallpaper with extremely old carpet. But that's not exactly what I prioritize when I'm looking for a hotel. We're travellers, moving around a lot (which is why we're in a hotel). So we need a REALLY comfortable bed, quiet when it counts, nice bathrooms, room service that accomodates our weird schedules, delivered by reasonably friendly faces. The ambience at Parco dei Principi was so self important in general that there seemed to be little effort to meeting those kinds of visitor expectations. I had the same if not worse reception at the Excelsior so it's not like I can recommend a better alternative in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “25th wedding anniversary in Parco dei Principi”
Reviews.Author: Cailinnua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were 25years married this month.I had studied all hotels in Rome for about 3weeks before booking this hotel. I had especially requested an non smoking room as i have asthma and detest the smell of smoke. On arrival i noticed an ashtray on the bedside locker and a stale smell of cigarettes. i immediately went to reception to be told that they dont have non smoking rooms. I grumbled to my husband for a while and decided not to let this go. The decor in the hotel is fabulous and the rooms are very opulent but the bathroom was surprisingly small with a large crack in one of the bathtiles. After breakfast next morning i again went to reception to state my case . I stated i had booked an non smoking superior room. The gentleman said he would show me alternative rooms , which were the same. He stated that they could not guarentee an non smoking as a previous guest may have had a cigar and they could not control this . He also stated they had already upgraded us to a deluxe room. after a sinister look from my husband we decided to stay in the room we were in. The breakfasts were amazing but the hot food could have been a lot warmer. The staff are very professional and most of them helpful. The hotel is decorated fabulously and absolutely spotless. The room cleaning was incrediable and very frequent. Bar prices a little expensive. I think I had expected too much from a 5star deluxe hotel and after reading previous reviews possibly expected to be upgraded to a suite for our 25th wedding anniversary but was not . I was promised a bottle of champagne which we never got but who cares ROME is absolutely amazing. WOW. Parco dei principi is no doubt a fabulous hotel but is off the beaten track and along walk or taxi ride from the centre. i hope this review may be of help. If you are booking this hotel try to get the fifth floor up because the rooms have been renovated. I will definately go back to ROME but bacause of location and my preferences not to this hotel. Enjoy Rome i know ill never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve at Parco Dei Principi”
Reviews.Author: USTraveller123
Reviews.Content: While I wouldn't rate this anywhere close to my favorite hotel, it did provide one of my most memorable lodging experiences. We stayed here during New Years weekend in 2006/2007. As far as hotel details went, I really liked the suite. It was large, with a balcony with a great view and a large hand-painted mural on the wall. The food in the restaurant was largely forgettable, and the fitness center was something they should be ashamed of. First, it was about a three minute walk through the cold air from the lobby to get there, which didn't make much difference, since the temperature inside was about 40 degrees Fahrenheit -- they didn't have any heating. The equipment was the worst I've seen anywhere -- the treadmill was so cheap it didn't operate off of electricity. The concierges were the highlight. They looked and acted like ruggedly handsome, middle-aged politicians or movie stars. One bragged that he could get a private jet, ready to go anywhere in the world, in less than an hour. But when it came to getting a ticket to a museum or giving advice as to where to get an electronics part he wasn't much good for anything. He did however provide us with two tickets at 600 Euros each to the New Years festivities at the hotel. These were obtained with great difficulty, after a two day waiting period and after other guests cancelled, because of the great demand for the event. There was to be an orchestra, a 6 course meal, and a fireworks display. Well, it looked like they only had about 30 guests show up for the New Years Spectacular, but room for about 2X that. And the orchestra turned out to be a guy on an electronic organ singing Volare. The highlight of the evening was when my overly uptight, extremely polite girlfriend got drunk and spilled her champagne all over the $3000 dress of a grande Italian dame who was not very pleased to say the least. We ended the evening on our balcony, as fireworks went off throughout the city until about 5:00 AM. There was smoke in the air all night long and it seemed like we were in a war zone. I do highly recommend Rome on New Years Eve, although I"d have to say I'm neutral about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location for celebration!”
Reviews.Author: LynetteC
Reviews.Content: My husband, son & I enjoyed a five day break at the Parco dei Principi to celebrate our Pearl Wedding anniversary in September. On arrival, and during our stay, the service of the concierge was first class....very efficient and friendly...We were allocated a suite which was beautifully appointed and comfortable complete with complimentary wine and chocolates upon arrival .The public rooms are very opulent, comfortable and spotlessly clean...We enjoyed a buffet luncheon in the hotel and, whilst not the least expensive in Rome, it was delicious, beautifully presented and represented good value for money;wine being included. We also ate in the restaurant one evening and, again the same applied...fabulous food, first class service and a good atmosphere...Gentle, appropriate Italian background music would have been the only enhancement for our liking! The food was vastly superior to a similarly priced dinner which we had on the Via Veneto! The swimming pool and grounds are wonderfully quiet and relaxing...Whilst this is not meant as a criticism but only as a suggestion, the offer of an occasional poolside refreshment service would, perhaps, be appropriate and may also, indeed, prove to be profitable for the hotel! The location of the hotel was fine for our needs, quiet and tranquil...the walk through the Villa Borghese was delightful...and taking a taxi from the hotel if needed was relatively inexpensive and easy. In conclusion, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Parco dei Principi...a wonderful experience and a fabulous break...We all threw our coin in the Trevi Fountain and truly hope that we will return both to Rome and to this superb hotel very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful oasis in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DebbieWLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and we really wanted to be able to relax as well as see the sites so we picked this hotel because it had a pool, suites and was in the middle of the park. We were initially worried it might be really far out but decided we'd take taxis everywhere if so. It lived up to all it promised and more. The most memorable things were the staff and the beautiful quiteness in a city known for it's noise. First the staff - they could not do enough for us and it was with such a friendly, fun, professional attitude. For example the pool attendant lent us his suntan cream, the front desk said they would arrange dinner for us if we told them what kind of evening we fancied, the waiter opened up a private area on the terrace for us for breakfast. None of this was too much trouble in fact they seemed to love making us happy. Next the surroundings. It was beautifully quiet with a gorgeous terrace and pool. The setting in the park was lovely and we woke up to the most amazing view all the way through the park to St Peter's from our bed. Finally the location. Well, first there's a half hour shuttle to and from the Spanish Steps until about 7pm every night. Second, blimey it's not that far - it's probably a mile or two (that the taxi was 5 euros should give you an idea) and frankly it was lovely to return to the hotel and escape central Rome. I would liken it to the distance from St Johns Wood to central London. So overall, yes, go here - you'll love it as we certainly did. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Dinn20
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights here at the end of a 14 day holiday in Sorrento and Umbria. It was the August bank holiday weekend and we arrived with our 4 children and Grandparents at 1pm on the Saturday. Both rooms were ready and the staff were happy to unpack our minivan and park it opposite the hotel. The hotel has a private car park at 23 euros a night, however the excellent reception staff kindly advised us it was 3 euro to park in the street and free on Sundays. We had 2 interconnectiong rooms on the 2nd floor, which were perfectly appointed with double king size bed in 1 room and twin beds a cot in the other. We brought our own travel cot for the baby. Although we were advised there would be an extra charge for the cot for our 2 year old toddler this was not on the final bill. The rooms although not large are decorated beautifully and individually, the bathrooms again are not large but are lovely marble with robes, slippers and quality toiletries. The Grandparents were not staying but they were made welcome to waste a few hours before thier flight. The hotel arranged a car for their journey, this cost 60 euros, which was promt and for a Mecedes S class good value. The only negative points that I cant think of are the breakfast is good but not outstanding and the bar located downstairs in the lobby doesnt have much atmosphere. However the quality of the staff from the recption to the chamber maid and even the pool attendent is first class and the pool is such luxury and a real oasis in the heat of Rome in August. We paid 300 euros a night per room which we thought was pretty good value. This really is a lovely hotel, we will be visiting again in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDLOVERS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Grand Hotel Parco Dei Prinicipi for a five night Easter break. The entrance lobby is suitably grand and the rooms are beautiful, sumptuous and extrememly comfortable. All staff were fantastically helpful - we were especially delighted by the multi-lingual reception staff and the waiters who offered Espresso and warm milk - delicious! The location is quiet and very near to the beautiful Villa Borghese Park. During our stay, we even had the pleasure of meeting the Manchester United team, as they were staying at the hotel prior to their match with Roma (which we also attended, courtesy of the team!) - so it really is the place fr a spot of celeb spotting! We were enchanted by this luxurious hotel and without a doubt, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Pool excellent , food poor”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlevum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in August , at a time when Rome is very hot and closing down for the holidays. Afternoons by the pool , after a morning of sightseeing , were very relaxing. The pool was excellent and surprisingly unbusy. However , the shine was taken off our stay by the fact that though we were staying half board (unavoidable on our deal) the evening meals were poor , so much so that we went out for two nights. It was flavourless, pretentiously described and served , and the menu did not change. The food was not worthy of a three star hotel let alone a five star hotel. The lunch we had by the pool (two sanwiches and a salad) was eye wateringly expensive and vile. If anyone thinks this hotel serves good food then they must have low standards. The hotel is a fair way from the sights and centre of Rome so we spent a lot on taxis. The hotel's shuttle bus did not appear to be operative , and only went so far as the Via Veneto. If you want somewhere in Rome with a pool in which to relax (not much choice I am afraid) this is a good hotel , but if you want good food and to be able to nip back to the hotel during the day this is not for you. If you can stay at the hotel without having to go half board then that would be good.

Reviews.Title: “first class in Rome”
Reviews.Author: wildroverWicklow
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - great location - all in all very worthwhile spot to stay for a trip to Rome. Staff Food and the fact of having a pool in Rome makes this a winner. It is a fifteen minute walk through the park to the spanish steps and pretty much everything else in Rome you can hit on foot from here. Hotel restaurant is superb and coming from Ireland as cities go this was not considered expensive or over the top by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Clmatch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parco di Principi in June of 1997. My mom treated me to a tour of Italy and this spot was beautiful. Great location too- quiet but not far from all the attractions. When we got to our room we thought we died and went to heaven! The whole bathroom, including the ceiling was all polished marble. The room was drenched in antique furnishings incredible fabrics and was extremely clean. We loved the overall feeling of this hotel. If you want to spoil yourself in beautiful surroundings and pure luxury- this is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff but food very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: madamB
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find that the rooms we had booked were not ready. This was 1.00 p.m. so we waited until 2.30 p.m. when we were told that the rooms were available. We were upgraded to a suite which consisted of two bedrooms adjoining an enormous sitting room. The double bedroom was VERY claustrophobic as there was only a little door at the side of the wardroble which meant very little light got into the room and the lights had to be on during the day in order to be able to see! The large living room, however, had a settee which could be made up as a single bed so I asked at Reception if they would mind making it up for me so that I could sleep in there instead: they were very helpful and only too happy to please. The next day, the bed was dismantled and put back as a sofa..... The pool was wonderful although we did find the pool attendants very "off". The food at the pool bar was pleasant but very expensive and the food in the hotel was ok if a little disappointing. It was nonetheless a very nice end to our holiday and we would definitely think of returning. Do make sure that you get a room facing the back of the hotel and preferably towards the centre as the street bins at the side of the hotel are emptied very early in the morning which can be very disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: F0rdster
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights for our 10th wedding anniversary in June and pushed the boat out by booking a senior suite. When we arrived at 11:00 am) the room was not ready. The reception were very apologetic but I said not too worry as I wouldn't expect the room to be ready at that time. We left out bags and went for a walk around the lovely Borhese gardens which are just behind the hotel. When we returned later in the afternoon the room was ready and we were shown to it. The room was actually a junior suite and not the senior that I had booked so I queried this. The manager explained that the junior suite had a better view (it was at the back of the hotel and looked out over the Borghese gardens to St. Peters). I asked to see the senior suite and this was at the side of the hotel on a lower floor with a not very good view so I decided to take the junior. The senior and junior suites are about the same size, the only difference is that the living room is separate in the senior suites rather than just through an arch in the junior suites so I'd go for the view every time. The room was fantastic with a balcony with a stunning view, a living area, dressing room, sleeping area with huge bed and a gorgeous marble bathroom (actually more like 2 rooms as the shower and double handbasins were in one room which led to another room that contained the bath, toiled and bidet). We also had a lovely oil painting the full length of the wall in the living area The pictures on the hotel website are 100% accurate, the hotel really does look like that and I'd even guess that we had the junior suite that they photographed! We had booked to stay half-board and so ate in the restaurant every evening. We only had to give our name and room number the 1st night and from that point on all the staff recognised us and showed us to our table and knew what we were drinking. They were all very friendly and the service was excellent. The menu is a little limited (no good for vegetarians) but there was enough choice. At the start of the week the food was superb but towards the end it wasn't quite as good so I suspect it was a different chef (the presentation was also not as well done). Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice - scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, etc. Again the service was excellent and the staff would usually remember your tea/coffee order if they had served you previously. As people have said the hotel is a little further from the centre but I believe they run a shuttle bus to the Via Veneto and Spanish Steps. As we like to walk we didn't use this, instead walking through the Borghese Gardens to the Via Veneto and then into the centre. Upon returning home my wife realised she had lost her necklace. I e-mailed the hotel concierge to see if it had been left in the room but didn't expect that it would be found. I received a very prompt reply informing me that they had indeed found it and they put it in the post for me (free of charge!) and we received it back a few days later. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. The service is excellent and the staff very friendly. I was worried that it would be "stuck up" but they treat you like family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, bit out from the center”
Reviews.Author: Something-Different!
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen specifically as it was a special birthday present for my mother.The hotel arranged transportation from the airport for us in a standard Merc. I was pricey at about £60 one way but worth it. The reception staff I found to be courteous, if a little aloof. Our bags were transfers immediately to our room. Upon entering our room you had a long hall way that had a bathroom entrance to one side at at the end what would be the living room. As there were 3 of us sharing, the living room was made into a bedroom with a not too uncomfortable pull down bed.It also had tv, writing desk own minibar etc. I door lead to the main bedroom which was a very good size and had its own entrance to the bathroom. It had full built in wardrobes, tv, another minibar and a king size bed.
