As we were at the side of the hotel we unfortunately did not have a view over to St Peters (which the rooms at the back do - request this when making your booking). Breakfast was more than adequate, with full range of pastries, cereals, fruits as well as cooked items such as sausage etc. As we had booked the hotel on a half-board basis we ate in their restaurant for 2 nights of our stay (the rest of the time in various restaurants on the Piazza Navarone). The waiting staff were excellent, and although it was not a full al la carte menu, the choice was very good, well presented and very good to eat. The swimming pool was excellent, and also very private. Full marks to the cocktail waiter who even made up his own cocktail for us. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. I would however point our that it is quite some distance from the Via Veneto although it is walkable. Not for those who are looking for loud nightlife etc.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service..Avoid”
Reviews.Author: SimonLancaster
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed at a different hotel to my fellow British citizens who have recently reviewed this hotel. 1. Booked directly with the hotel. When I arrived they had no reservation for me.. wonderful. With this omen I should have said ok and moved to the Via Veneto. 2. Arrived by car (Ferrari). Ignorant doorman only interested in getting hold of my car keys and parking the car. Luggage(expensive) Pulled from the car at an allarming rate and dumped in reception. Other lighter items like camera case, DVD cam pulled from car and dumped on roof of car. So unproffessional. Doorman repromanded and told that if the car roof was scratched I WOULD HOLD HIM responsible. He never spoke to me or my partner again for the next 5 days. 3.Concierge mixed up 3 out of 4 restaurant reservations. I was very specific and even gave him the telephone numbers and address of where I wanted reservations to be made. He was only intrested in "pushing" the trattorias he knew( which wern't very many as he lived outside of Rome!!) 4.Pool quite nice but water was hotter than a bath. 5.During my stay there were hordes of Tour bus trips staying. The pool was overrun with screaming (mostly American) teens. I thought I was in summer camp..not what you expect in a..remember...5 Star Lux (and Im quoting their blurb) hotel. 6.Breakfast a disgrace..do not pay extra for it. 7.Hotel restaurant overpriced with very mediocre food. 8.Sat for 20 minutes at the poolside restaurant with 4 staff in attendance waiting to be served let alone greeted on arrival.After nothing happened I went to reception..demanded to see the Hotel Manager and Restaurant Manager. After telling them exactly what I thought of the service in the hotel..guess what. Apot of flowers was ent to the room.......wonderful. I could go on and on but I can not be bothered..if you have any taste at all I would avoid this place. The decor is grand but the service and everything else is woeful. If you are wondering why I booked in the first place. I have stayed at its sister hotel The Splendide Royal which was wonderful but was fully booked for my dates.Just how a 5star should be. Just goes to show hot two hotels not 5 minutes away from one another run by the same guy (only 4 hotels in the entire group) can be so different. Avoid Avoid Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tim2000
Reviews.Content: From the excellent communication with the Concierge by email prior to my arrival to arrange transport from the airport, to the upgraded room, to the free wine and biscuits delivered free to the room, this hotel has got it just about right. The fabulous pool is just perfect and the location, about 10 mins outside town, is not a problem - less than Eur10 by taxi. As others have said, the level of service is outstanding and really friendly. The only downsides are (i) no access to free water anywhere in the hotel or room and having to pay Eur3.50 for a small bottle and (ii) the poolside restaurant is great, but the staff seem overwhelemed when there is more than one table in need of a sandwich. Overall, great hotel, great staff, wouldn't hesitate to stay there again - recommended

Reviews.Title: “perfect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel, everything you could ever want - great pool, marveloous room (we had a suite), pure luxury, view of St Peters from balcony, quiet location (although only 20 mins from Spanish steps through Borghese gardens). Perfect. Coming back again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Even Manchester United Football Club uses the hotel”
Reviews.Author: HHHCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: To call Grand Hotel Parco dei Principi a 5 star hotel, is a truth with modifications. We would probably rate it as a 4 star hotel, but it's a very nice hotel. We got a very good deal - only 780 € for 4 nights - through an internet site, so we got no reason to complain. We had our doubts regarding the distance to all the attractions, but it really wasn't any problem. We walked every morning through the beautiful park Villa Borghese - 10 minute walk to Via del Corso. At night we didn't want to walk through the park, so we just got a taxi (between 5 - 8€ from Piazza di Spagna) The breakfast was quite good compared to what you normally get in Italy - a nice, large buffet. I guess we were not the only one to discover this hotel - the first morning we met a lot of policemen in front of the hotel and realized that the players of Manchester United stayed at this hotel after their meeting with Roma in Champions League. Next time we visit Rome, I think we would look for a hotel that is closer to the attractions! It would be best, if you could drop by your hotel during the day to drop of things you have bought, change your clothes etc. - and Grand Hotel Parco dei Principi is a bit far away to do just that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Clark1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of April and it was excellent. I was a bit worried about previous reviews saying that the location was a bit out of town, but it was great. We opted for a slightly out of town location because we have a young son and I didn't want the noise. Also, it has a pool, and is located on the edge of the Villa Bourghese park which is a great place to run round after been strapped in a buggy all day. We could walk to the Spanish steps within 15 minutes through the park, or a cab was 5 minutes and about €6. The hotel itself was excellent. It is classed as 5* and it lived up to this. The service was superb, the staff very friendly and the hotel restaurant served great food. We were on a half board arrangement and hadn't really planned to use it, but the restaurant was so good, we ate there 4 out of the 5 nights. The menu was €50 for 4 courses but we got this as part of our booking (Citalia) and it was well worth it. The hotel has a lovely, well heated pool which we aso enjoyed. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bipolar at the Parco”
Reviews.Author: MadameO
Reviews.Content: What a great location! (next to the Borghese Gardens) What a crummy location! (all the way out on the other side of the Gardens) What a great room! (that view on that balcony!) What a lousy room! (tiny, but average Euro-tiny) So quiet and peaceful! (no traffic noise) So remote! (no traffic means no cabs) and so it goes- for every great thing, there's a flip side. While the staff was attentive, there seemed to be some issues with language (room was too hot and un-fixed for the whole week I was there). And for 450 bucks for laundry, losing my jeans was unacceptable. However, I do NOT want to paint a bad picture- I had a fine stay, and would recommend it to any one. Just with some watch-outs!

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel Parco Dei Principi
HotelInfo.Address: Via G Frescobaldi 5, 00198 Rome, Italy
